reviews.title: Love it
reviews.review_text: Couldn't be happier with this purchase. Drives like a dream and looks brand new. The 2014 is the same look as the new ones.

reviews.title: Just as we hoped it would be.
reviews.review_text: Our 5th Acura and we will stay with the brand. The MDX is the best one yet. Only the Acura TL is more fun to drive.

reviews.title: Stylish looks, smooth ride, great performance.
reviews.review_text: Love the clean lines of the vehicle. It has a smooth controlled ride and snappy performance. Seats 3 adults and 4 kids comfortably with room in the trunk.

reviews.title: In love with our 2014 CPO Acura MDX
reviews.review_text: We purchased this vehicle from an Acura dealer upon researching that the overall interior space, gas mileage and comfort/styling lined up with our family needs. We have 3 small children and the rear seat is an easy access for our 4 year old by the push of a button. Also, the second row slides which is great for changing space needs. Everything about this car is easy, and its extremely intelligent. The smart keys (driver 1 & driver 2) correspond to the settings of everything when you climb in. We highly recommend the tech package since it adds lots of style and convenience. You'll enjoy having selectable transmission and driving modes as well with paddle shifters and a responsive engine.

reviews.title: Sporty Mom Car
reviews.review_text: Love everything about this car. Great for our family but also stylish and sporty. Has lots of gitty-up power!

reviews.title: The best vehicle I've ever owned
reviews.review_text: Great vehicle for the money. The advanced package is nice. Could ride a little softer at times. Great gas mileage for an all wheel drive SUV.

reviews.title: It Alright
reviews.review_text: I have the 2014 Acura MDX FWD. It drives smooth on the highway but on Brooklyn, NY bumpy roads it not that good. When I hit a bump as the driver I feel it. I don't know if its the suspension or that's the way it is. Again on the a smooth highway it rides great.

reviews.title: 2014 awd mdx tech pckg
reviews.review_text: I have been with acura/honda family for the longest and this will be my last car with them......i bought this brand new 2014 mdx awd tech pckg.....this car giving me nothing but problems from day one and I can't wait till get out of my lease which is about to end soon....terribly built this car by Honda they call this car is luxury....it's a complete joke.....ever since bought this car I been running to the service department more often then anything.....but problems never been resolved.....called the acura corporate explain them and even the dealership bought the car from but no one helped or cared about the problems I been having with the car.....so if you're in the market looking for car please do think about the headaches you'll buy with the car.....I'm mentally and physically worn out with this car problems....from the engine/transmission etc and more problems

reviews.title: Super car
reviews.review_text: We purchased an advanced technology with entertainment. The car is phenomenal what it is capable of. Sound system is great. Quiet, smooth, rides great. Could be happier.

reviews.title: Most congested Honda I have ever bought.
reviews.user_location: My name is zareen and I am a house wife.
reviews.review_text: I have owned many SUVS before, including all the pilot and odyssey. And love them all blindly trust on Honda and bought MDX. This is worst product from Honda.smallest 7 seater , smallest trunk no space in between seats. For family with babies more worst because seat cant recline and any good brand of babies reclining seats are not fit in it.For long drive pain full back seats.

reviews.title: 2015 MDX
reviews.review_text: Gas mileage is great. Even in the city. Winter driving is difficult to get used to. Drive by wire is so disconnected from the road that it feels like a cotton filled hazmat suit. Safe but no fun. Haptics are horrible. Multiple button pushes where a single switch setting used to be sufficient. Do not attempt to use the radio or adjust the seat warmer while you are moving! You will not see the traffic coming at you. Do not wear gloves either! Still it moves well, loads all of the people and gear I need to and looks great.

reviews.title: Outstanding SUV
reviews.review_text: I have put 13,000 miles on my 2014 MDX with Tech Package and find it a delightful car. It's cornering ability is will surprise most drivers and I have been getting an average of 22.7 MPG. The sound system is excellent and the driver can pick the perceived firmness of the ride. The only things I would like better would be a larger gas tank and a tighter front end -- more European style -- like rack and pinion steering. Otherwise, this is a great automobile and I plan to drive it for a long time.

reviews.title: Good Value
reviews.review_text: We drove every car out there in the category and only the MDX ticked all the boxes. Even the difference between the 2013 and 2014 was a big jump in comfort and features.

reviews.title: none
reviews.review_text: This is my second MDX and this one is a definite improvement over the 2011. I am having one problem and that is the front lower trim is coming loose. The dealer is ordering new parts to make the repair. So far I am enjoying the car and would recommend anyone to buy one.

reviews.title: Acura MDX Experience
reviews.review_text: Probably the most satisfying thing about the MDX is the milage. I have gotten over 32 MPG on the highway. It's just awsome from that perspective. I have only had the car a few weeks, so really am not qualified to make a lot of claims about it. However, the car certainly has all the bells and whistles with the technology package. I'm not sure we'll ever master all the features. Should mention, on our older MDX, the milage was not even close to what we get on this one!

reviews.title: Total makeover
reviews.review_text: The very first time in 55 years on the road I have seen manufacturer understate MPG on the highway. Only had this car for couple of weeks but the decision to buy brand new car proved as the correct one. This is after 40 years of buying late models of luxury cars to avoid first year depreciation. I traded in 2005 MDX which was flawless for 73000 miles and never needed anything beside the regular scheduled maintenance and gas. To those that are deciding between MDX and BMW X5: Do not fall for the hype of ULTIMATE DRIVING MACHINE for extra 20 grand. It does not come even close in a whole slew of important features and performance. The pretty grill with an emblem is hardly worth 20,000.00 on any car.

reviews.title: Biggest car I have ever owned
reviews.review_text: Very comfortable ride and the vehicle drives for you. Still learning about all the bells and whistles.

reviews.title: Nice vehicle except the very annoying whistling.
reviews.review_text: Nice and Spacious. Acceleration is OK. Value for money is good. It now has around 1500 miles. Cons: It has a very annoying high frequency metal whistling from around 30 mph onwards while accelerating and maintaining constant speed. According to Acura this is normal! What were they thinking? I hope that they will fix it. My vehicle do not have the bumper alignment issue that many reported.

reviews.title: Very nice ride
reviews.review_text: I was initially undecided between MDX and QX60. After test driving both the only advantage of QX60 is more legroom in second row. MDX has great acceleration, handling and comfort. The split screen info on dash took a little bit to get used to but now it is great. The tech packages a must. A great car.

reviews.title: High Tech Car
reviews.review_text: Love the advanced technology in the Tech package. Takes a little getting used to, but after a few days and a trip, it is now second nature. The interior feels roomy and comfortable. The audio is magnificent. I ordered running boards and roof rails which really add to the exterior appearance.

reviews.title: Most comfortable car I have owned.
reviews.review_text: This is the fourth MDX we have owned and it is truly the most comfortable riding and driving car we have ever ridden in. You can drive for hours and not feel tired. We have received many complements on how sharp it looks. Thanks again for a great car! We would recommend it to anyone.

reviews.title: Best SUV that i ever owned!! 4th one!
reviews.review_text: Awesome SUV! Comfortable, stylish, rides very nice! One complaint is that , for a luxury SUV and for it's price point, Navigation should be standard! We have all these cheaper brands that has Navigation standard, yet Acura only includes Navigation as part of High Tech package! Bad decision!!

reviews.title: Drove from Toronto to Florida and back
reviews.review_text: Traded my BMW X5 for the MDX. Too many reliability issues with the BMW. Drove to Florida with 6 people. Car was very comfortable and quiet. Lots of luggage room. Plenty of power to over take and going up hills. Breaks were OK could be a bit better especially going downhill. 3rd row is OK for small kids but tight for adults. LED lights lit up the roadway. Love the centre console huge storage space and under cargo storage. Had car for 3 months now and it is wonderful no issues. Worth every penny. Very stable and safe in snow and ice. Good on gas.

reviews.title: First Acura i've owned
reviews.review_text: Me and my wife who is expecting our 2nd child decided that we need to have a 7 seater SUV. We have a Murano 11 previously. We had 5 Cars on the list to look at. MDX, Highlander, Explorer, QX60 and Pathfinder. We test drove the MDX first. It has a very confident driving trait, nice soft touch materials and technology package. The salesperson guided us in a winding backroads with moderate potholes. This car owned it. The downside is that the space is relatively smaller than the qx60 and brakes are mushy feel although still safe. We got an offer and then we went to infiniti. Qx60 is all about luxury. The only gripe about it is that the driving felt like i am on a pathfinder although 10k more expensive. Same platform, same transmissions and engine. But the size is awesome. There is fine jittery ride over the bumps although muted i noticed it. We also went to Ford. lots of bells and whistles on the explorer but when you drive it. Forget it, it feels like driving a truck. Without the ecoboost engine. their v6 is lame. We left and didn't like the Sales Manager either. Now highlander, We went there and we saw the sticker price for a highlander hybrid.($51k) My wife agreed about how cheap the interior felt and we left. Wife agreed. its Over priced. So in the end we end up with MDX. It's a beauty and classic. Then now here comes an issue. I am pretty sensitive with vibrations and sound on a car. When i had the car for 2 days, I didn't hear anything, it was Dead silent. However, this monday before i dropped of the car to install the accessories, i noticed a weird fluttering noise. It is low pitch but is really noticeable. This sound coincide when you only push the gas pedal. I asked the tech and he noticed it. He then said "its the fuel pump, its all normal" that i was just entuned to it and it will fade away as i get used to it. Sadly i haven't still. I cannot enjoy my quiet ride without turning off the music co'z i can hear it. i sent an email to Acura relations and will post their response. For a car that is at 50k, I expect a very quiet cabin. The road noise is muted but that fluttering noise exist. It might not bother a lot of owners. Sure has bothered me. I have read of owners having problems with the Variable Management , Heared no problem like that on my car. Shifting is Smooth, Plenty of power when needed. Gas Mileage still not to par. Thinking due to Very low temp. Overall, It is byfar the Best SUV in the market at its Category

reviews.title: very smooth and quiet ride
reviews.review_text: has all but spare tire on fwd, bucket seats 2nd row. otherwise 1st class auto great for travel. highly recommend for families that like to travel, or play sports

reviews.title: Several bugs and issues
reviews.review_text: Purchased the MDX in August 2013. Since then I have had problems with the navigation system freezing, voice commands not accepted, phone not linking to the car (Blue Tooth issues). There was also a recall for a drive train bolt which was not properly torqued. The dealer replaced the navigation module (apparently there were two major software revisions in 6 months). Upon getting the car back, I no longer had functioning intermittent windshield wipers, and I am receiving a Charging System Warning notice. Noises are coming from the engine (and yes, I had the oil changed by Acura). I loved the car when I got it, but this is very disappointing.

reviews.title: Sure footed in heavy Michigan snow
reviews.review_text: I cannot say enough how much of a lifesavor our 14-MDX SH-AW base model has been for us this winter. My wife and I are both physicians and on numerous occasions we had to brave the harshest wintery slick weather to get to work and we could not have done it without our beautiful SUV. My wife unfortunately did get into a miner fender bender. She got rear ended because the SUV behind her could not stop in time. He had a dent, our vehicle didn't even have a scratch. I would highly recommend this suv.

reviews.title: LOVE THIS CAR!
reviews.review_text: This is my first car in 10 years,I am very happy with my choice.I am challenged to learn more about this car because it is a computer on wheels. I love the smooth ride.This car is pretty easy on the eyes as well. Choose this car over volvo x 90 because of its safety rating and good looks.

reviews.title: Second Acura MDX I've owned
reviews.review_text: Quiet and powerful, brakes are good, but feel a little soft when I compare it to my 2005 Acura MDX, which seemed more precise and surer to me. Essentially the MDX is a computer on four wheels with two manuals weighing pounds. A bit intimidating at first with all those bells,button's,whistles and four way knobs. This is week two of ownership, and it feels somewhat more familiar. It will take weeks more to know the cabin well. Not sure I will ever like the voice guidance. It often doesn't get it! Liked my 2005 GPS as I could have my wife adjust,change where we are going while car was in motion. The new GPS seems to not want to work unless I'm totally stopped. Big Brother has intervened too much here. I like the blind spot indicator that allows you to note a car in your dead zone. The lane indicator beeps at you if you cross a traffic line above 45 mph without the turn indicator on. Can be a tiny bit bothersome and a bit strict.Yet it is doing it's job and reporting on me to me. Again, slightly Big Brotherly. Overall, a swell car, drives like a fine luxury car, not an SUV. Is as quick as can be (I purchased the front wheel drive model as I live in Calif) and a pleasure to drive (I do long distance driving, and this car is perfect for that). Improvements? Acura Roadside Assistance is not nearly as quick as AAA. Proved that twice. Acura wait time: one hour. AAA wait time 20 minutes. Overall Recommendation? Buy it. My 2005 Acura MDX currently has 190,000 miles on it, with absolutely nothing wrong with it. Nothing! A fantastic auto,and my reason for buying a 2014 Acura MDX again!

reviews.title: Nice to look at, most annoying ride I ever owned
reviews.review_text: Sure, the car is pretty, has all the bells and whistles you would want. However after driving this vehicle for several months, and having it at Acura multiple times, I only suggest buying this vehicle if you are buying on looks alone. While driving, the vehicle transitions from 3 cylinders to 6, the car vibrates hard on the front left side, and RPM's drop. If I drive at a steady 60 miles on the highway it will constantly do it over and over, feels like you are driving on a rumble strip. Most annoying feeling, and sound! Acura district Rep tells me its normal function for this vehicle. I test drove others at dealership and they were doing it as well. I am very disappointed that Acura thinks this is okay. I only wish I had read the forums online first where people were complaining.

reviews.title: First Luxury Car
reviews.review_text: I have had many Hondas over the years, but I never crossed over into the luxury market. Now that the kids are out of the house, I bought the luxury car I have thought about for 10 years. So far I love all the features, bells and whistles.

reviews.title: Wonderful Vehicle extremely quiet and comfortable
reviews.review_text: I just replaced my 2012 TL Tech with a 2014 MDX SH-AWD Tech. Drove it 1200 miles in the first 3 days. It handles as well if not better than the 2WD TL. It is remarkable quiet. I don't think I have ever been in a quieter vehicle. I averaged 71mph on our 1100 mile trip and averaged 28 mpg on mid grade fuel. The seats are very comfortable and the interior is very attractive. I could not be happier.

reviews.title: Most Technology for the money
reviews.review_text: The MDX offers more standard features on the base level, entry car for the money. By adding the Advance package and Entertainment package, you end up more technology and some industry standards and firsts. The most impressive is the lane keep assist that works with the cruise at speeds over 40 MPH. We have all been there, long drive, cruise set, mind elsewhere. This feature helps you keep it between the lines and keeps the preset distance to the car ahead of you. Amazing to accomplish this in a vehicle under 60K.

reviews.title: Best New Car My Wife Has Ever Owned
reviews.review_text: Our 2014 Acura MDX is the total package: beautiful exterior styling, comfortable and functional interior, plenty of room, great gas mileage, very quiet, advanced technology, and all wheel drive. We love it!

reviews.title: Best MDX so far
reviews.review_text: This is my 4th MDX over the last 7 years. I've enjoyed all of the models, but this year's version is the best. New style change inside and outside. I've moved up with the Advanced Package which has all of the tech and luxury options that you can imagine. Still working out which driving options work best for me. The only unknown so far is the gas mileage, advertised at 26 mpg highway for AWD version. Haven't seen that yet but it is still early. I would recommend you take a look at this model, haven't seen many out on the road so I'm enjoying being one of the first to have this model.

reviews.title: THE CAR I LIKE
reviews.review_text: it is a great car I like it. but I don't like exterior style because it looks a van .............................

reviews.title: Worst Vehicle I've Ever Owned!
reviews.review_text: I bought the 2014 MDX Advance with Entertainment Package and drove it for 6 days when it started having Emission System and other problems. Since then, it has been at the dealership for repair for 45 days and is still there. I have been very disappointed in the quality and reliability of this vehicle but I have been more disturbed with the lack of responsiveness from Acura's Client Relations department. At this price range, there are many options and I would not choose an Acura. The vehicle is cheaply made and in my opinion, Acura has not worked out their glitches in their new design.

reviews.title: MDX
reviews.review_text: The car drives great,I don't like the fact that everything shuts off when you shot down the engine,that includes interior lights,radio,etc.The radio dosn't show the song title or the singer.They need to correct a few problems.

reviews.title: Great car for the price
reviews.review_text: Great car for the price. I would put it up with MB or BMW......close in quality for ALOT less. Worth a look

reviews.title: Acura MDX 2014
reviews.review_text: Love the whole redesign for 2014. It is significantly improved. First time Acura owner and just bought the ILX also. Very happy with Acura. Purchased at Mike Hale Acura in Murray. Very pleased with the level of service and sales.

reviews.title: Best value for volume, safety, economy and styling
reviews.review_text: Major improvement from previous generation. Smaller on the outside, larger on the inside, no premgas

reviews.title: 2nd MDX and not disappointed
reviews.review_text: I previously owned a 2005 MDX and drove it for absolutely trouble free miles. I did not care for the version that came just after mine, so I waited for this new body style and redesign. I was not at all disappointed. The car drives amazingly well, is well styled, and has features galore. I am not at all disappointed in my choice. I would make two comments - the more advanced safety features should be in the Technology Package, not the more expensive option package, and I only use the Sport handling package.

reviews.title: 2014 Acura MDS
reviews.review_text: I traded in a 2006 MDX for a 2014 MDX. There is no comparison. The drive and handling of the new MDX is amazing. I highly recommend the technology package.

reviews.title: 2114 ACURA MDX TECH
reviews.review_text: Very good car, excellent features, good gas mileage, comfortable excellent technology. The navi system works great, voice commands are easy, XM radio a plus.

reviews.title: Great New Design
reviews.review_text: Love the lane changing notification. It fixes the "blind spot" issue in the previous design. Handles nicely, smooth ride, like the instrument panel design better than the previous design. Great design with the storage compartment under the middle arm rest. Also love that the arm rest moves forward. One thing that is not as good as my previous MDX, (2004) is the driver's seat does not lower as much in the front. This is nice feature for those of us 5'4" that like the seat higher but like the front lower to make it easier to reach the pedals.

reviews.title: Enjoying my new 2014 Acura MDX AWD Tech
reviews.review_text: I've owned Acura vehicles my entire life. Starting with an 97 Integra. Upgraded to a new 2007 TL and then to a new 2011 MDX AWD base. I just recently bought a brand new 2014 MDX AWD Tech and all I can say is that it is worth all my hard earned money. The ride is super smooth and my family loves the ride. My wife and mother agree is it was more comfortable than the 2011 MDX. The handling has also gotten better along with the fuel economy. The only thing I wish they did better on the vehicle was the voice recognition function.

reviews.title: Everything that it promised
reviews.review_text: weare very happy with our new Accura 2014 MDX. It is everything that the manufacturer promised. Fuel efficiency is great. we did a 400 mile road trip and got 26.5 mpg compared to the 27 mpg claim. The interior is very quiet with little road noise even at speed levels of 75 mph. Pick-up from zero was a bit slufggish, maybe because we use regular fuel since the dealer said that should be fine. Third row seats were are OK for adults, but we average 5'7'' . getting into the 3rd row is easier, but one has to get used to it. Overall vey happy with the purchase..

reviews.title: Nice luxury suv
reviews.review_text: Haven't owned the 2014 MDX for Lon but so far we are thrilled owners! The ride is great, gas mileage is good for SUV. The tech package is great but a bit challenging to figure out.

reviews.title: Great new design.....
reviews.review_text: Only had the car for 500 miles...is very handsome and extremely well made...The ride and handling are great. The gas mileage could be better..18-19. I've only mostly driven around town and a few short freeway trips. The down side is High test fuel is required. The interior is huge and very plush, lots of room for my two dogs. The new controls are still confusing to us old guys... Lots of standard features, but then again at this price, they should be.. Very glad I crossed over from Volvo and will be happy for a long long time...

reviews.title: Great Family Hauler
reviews.review_text: A big improvement over the outgoing model, Extremely quiet and cushy ride. It has less of a sport feel than the previous model but it is overall a better drive. Electronic steering can be adjusted from soft to firm with the push of a button and the response and different feel are immediate. Gears are always in great sync with the RPMs, audio is very good for the middle range model which is what I have (tech w/ entertainment). Only thing is that is hard to get a sense of speed in the highway with the car being very very quiet and the suspension soaking up bumps like nobody's business, better to remember where the cops usually hang out. Absolute best driving experience and features for the price, Europeans can simply not compete.

reviews.title: Most Reliable vehicle I've ever owned
reviews.review_text: This Vehicle has plenty of leg room, drives like a dream, fits all our needs and exceeds our expectations. I highly recommend the MDX, it's an awesome vehicle.

reviews.title: Reliable
reviews.review_text: Burns too much oil; add 1 qt. every 2500 miles. Has 60,000 miles on vehicle. Would expect better from this vehicle. This is a annoying and is there fix?

reviews.title: Great car! Second one I’ve owned.
reviews.review_text: Love this car. Would definitely recommend it. A little pricey but it’s an Acura so that’s expected. Only knock is the shocks. They go way too fast and a ridiculously expensive to replace!!

reviews.title: Great reliable SUV
reviews.review_text: This car meets all my needs. Smooth ride, great leg rooms. Stylish. Fits seven people. Gas saver. I have drove quite a few cars and truck in my life. This one is one favorite drive.

reviews.title: Love Love this SUV
reviews.review_text: I love the size,Luxury accessories color and smooth ride.I would reccomend to older persons too,so easy to get in no plopping yourself down to seat.

reviews.title: Wonderful luxury SUV!
reviews.review_text: Love this car! Comfortable, handles beautifully, sound system awesome. I am tall and the adjustments on the seat with memory is a wonderful feature. This car is fully loaded with features that other vehicles do not have. So happy I waited and found the perfect car!

reviews.title: Disappointed in Acura
reviews.review_text: Liked the MDX until I had to deal with Acura Warranty Support. XM radio would not work near cell towers and Acura would not fix it because all of the raid iOS for that model did it. Newer models didn’t have the same issues though. Promised compensation for not being able fix it then didn’t deliver. Buy new car in 2020 and it won’t be an Acura.

reviews.title: Drives like a sedan but loves the snow
reviews.review_text: Drives like a sedan but loves the snow! Great family car with every feature you might need form third row seat to a great stereo.

reviews.title: Love the look and very fun to drive
reviews.review_text: Car has met all my expectations. From how it looks, how it drives to the stereo system. I love everything and very happy I went with the Acura.

reviews.title: Awesome SUV
reviews.review_text: I’ve had this MDX for 3 years. It has never let me down. If you keep up with maintenance, it will always be there for you. I am religious about changing the fluids on my 2013 MDX. She runs like a new car. I plan on keeping her for at least 5 more years and hopefully longer. She’s 6 years old now and really showing no signs of aging. I absolutely love my Acura MDX.

reviews.title: Ultra Dependable & Great Value for the Money!
reviews.review_text: This is my 2nd MDX - my first MDX was a 2008 & I put 170K miles on it and it NEVER had a mechanical problem so the reliability is unmatched! Personally, I love the body style & the way it handles. I use it for work & for driving clients around so it's luxurious & roomy enough w/o the high price tag & $300 oil changes. I've owned a Lexus RX & BMW X3 and I'll go w/ the MDX all day long. The negatives would be the gas mileage (maybe 16-17 mpg city) & the initial acceleration from a dead stop, but my racing days are over, & it doesn't have a heated steering wheel. The safety tests are great, it handles like a champ in the snow w/ AWD, it has ample storage room (when the 3rd row seats are down), & the back seats are comfy. If you maintain it as you should, you shouldn't have any issues. Again, I've never had mechanical issues & I drive no less than 20K miles per year.

reviews.title: Very nice car
reviews.review_text: This car was very nice just not exactly what I wanted. Price and everything else was nice the interior was very unique, sun roof was awesome and car had great pick up and handling

reviews.title: Best of the premium SUV
reviews.review_text: This SUV is the best value for the money, high quality, very reliable, comfortable, reasonable gas mileage, good looking, good navigation device, good resale value, good interior features and lots of loading room.

reviews.title: Nice Car. Stylish
reviews.review_text: Nice car. Stylish, nice exterior and interior. Drives well. Dependable.Lots of space. Folding seat creates more space. Nice sound system and hard drives can sync and store sobgs

reviews.title: Elegant and zippy. It's beautiful and comfortable.
reviews.review_text: You would be proud to drive this car. I know you would love it. This is an elegant car, it's gorgeous and wonderful to drive -- a young person's ride.

reviews.title: Most reliable car I owned
reviews.review_text: This car meet all my needs. Plenty of legroom front & rear. Felt comfortable when I first sat in the drivers seat. Cool Back up camera and mirrors that move downwards when parking.

reviews.title: Very dependable SUV, plenty of room, seats 6
reviews.review_text: Excellent handling in all road conditions. Solid engine and transmission very responsive. Comfortable ride, AWD is excellent, never have been stuck. Nice interior. Excellent air conditioner.

reviews.title: Very reliable
reviews.review_text: Met all my needs. Amzaing and beutiful car on the road. Would conitnue owing this car as far as i can. Great fit for a family of 4

reviews.title: It was amazing, so I bought another!
reviews.review_text: The design and comfort were beyond expectations. Yes, they are a higher price SUV but you definitely get your money?s worth with the luxury and performance!

reviews.title: TEXAS FAMILY ON THIRD ACURA
reviews.review_text: Love this car. First Acura was 1991 Legend; Loved driving it even with no specific destination. Very responsive and hugged the road on curves. Truck hit it and totalled it.

reviews.title: 5 years and 50,000 miles with no repair issues.
reviews.review_text: Seven passengers is handy when you really don't want to take that extra car. But the space for hauling stuff and its towing ability make it ideal without having a great big SUV to park and burn extra gas every day.

reviews.title: Dependable Ride
reviews.review_text: I have my 2nd MDX. These SUV's are great. The size works and the SUV never lets me down. If you keep up with the maintenance this car will never do you wrong. I would highly recommend this vehicle to anyone. You will be very happy with your purchase.

reviews.title: Quiet and confortable car, good walue.
reviews.review_text: This used MDX is like new. Greta family car, confortable and quiet. Great safety features. We are enjoying the AWD, responsive and great handling. Has the navigation and backup camera.

reviews.title: Acura RL
reviews.review_text: this car was reliable, It was comfy and roomy for everyone. I would buy another one if I could! Acura's are awesome.

reviews.title: ACURA MDX is my #1
reviews.review_text: I love Acura's they are the only cars I buy. I needed to upgrade from my tl to an MDX because I have a yellow lab and needed the extra space. Love the safety features, reliability, and the fact that they are so beautiful and stylish. Best car ever hands down.

reviews.title: One of the best cars we have owned
reviews.review_text: Great performance and handling for an SUV. It is hard to believe the value when we compare it to more mainstream vehicles, our MDX blows them all away!

reviews.title: Great SUV
reviews.review_text: My first Acura MDX was deemed totaled after an accident. I was so upset because I really loved that car. That car has 104K on it and ran like a top. Because of my previous experience with Acura, I purchased a used 2013 Acura MDX this time. I test drove the Lexus RX350, but I could not switch. The Lexus RX was a boring ride and just not an MDX. I love the size and style of the MDX. It rides great, has great pickup and has plenty of room for people and things. I'm very happy with my 2013 Acura, and I hope to drive this car for many more years. It is a phenomenal car. Buying a used Acura is the way to go. Acura makes a great SUV.

reviews.title: Feeling sad I chose this car
reviews.review_text: I bought a 2013 MDX one month ago. Of course I had test drove it before I bought it and it seemed fine , however now that I drive it a lot I have major buyers remorse for 4 reasons. #1 - the headrest are terribly uncomfortable, if I put my back against the seat my head is thrust forward with my chin on my chest so I have to drive it sitting up without my back touching the seat. Look for yourself how forward the headrest are , terrible design! #2 - the radio is very static , I can not keep a radio station on while moving due to the static. The antenna is in the windshield and there are many reviews I read after I bought it that other people are having the same issues. #3- the 2nd and 3rd row seats do not move so you can not adjust the foot room. The Honda pilot I had before did have seats that moved so the kids could adjust it to their needs. #4- the gas mileage is terrible I do not like this car at all, its the most expensive car I have ever bought and I feel ripped off.

reviews.title: MY 2013 MDX
reviews.review_text: I AM THE PROUD OWNER OF A NEW 2013 MDX. FINDING ONE WAS DIFFICULT AS THE NEWER 2014 MODEL HAVE BEEN OUT SINCE JUNE & I HAD TO SHOP OUT OF STATE, STILL THE SUPPLY WAS VERY LIMITED. WHEN I COMPARED THE 2013 TO THE TOTALLY NEW 2014 MODEL, I WAS SURPRISED TO LEARN SEVERAL IMPORTANT DIFFERENCES. FIRST OF ALL, THE 2013 IS THE LAST OF THE 2ND GENERATION MDX WHICH STARTED IN 2007 & HAS PROVEN ITSELF OVER THE YEARS. I BELIEVE THE ALL NEW 2014 MDX HAS HAD A COUPLE OF RECALLS ALREADY. STYLING WISE, THE 2013 HAS A MORE AGGRESSIVE LOOK WITH IT'S MASSIVE DUAL CHROMED TIP EXHAUST PIPES, FOG LIGHTS, FLARED FENDERS, MUD FLAPS & A WIDER WIDTH. THIS IS ALL MISSING ON THE REDESIGNED, SLEEKER 2014 MODEL. THE 2013 ALSO HAS MORE HP, A GREATER TOWING CAPACITY, THANKS TO A TRANS/OIL COOLER & WEIGHS HUNDREDS OF POUNDS MORE. THE GAS MILEAGE IS REDUCED SOMEWHAT BUT THE EXTRA WEIGHT MUST PROVIDE A BETTER RIDE & GREATER SAFETY. ALL CONSIDERED, I AM VERY PLEASED WITH MY 2013 MDX & I SAVED THOUSANDS TOO.

reviews.title: Big mistake
reviews.review_text: Wow! My 5th MDX. With all of the changes to the 2014, I decided to go for it again. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT. Most of my issues relate to the terrible electronics. They have gone from what was clearly one of the best systems to operate (NAV, Controls, bluetooth etc) to a system that is pretty much impossible. Voice prompts are very difficult in a system that now forces you to use voice prompts for almost everything. My last MDX allowed me to do pretty much anything on the fly and this one is now one of those cars where the designers have determined that we are not smart enough as MDX drivers to determine what we should and not use when we are driving. Just try to set an address while you are on the go. A good percentage of the time, my NAV doesn't even boot up and I have to wait for a stoplight to shut off my car and start it up again (this always resolves the problem). Sometimes the bluetooth won't connect with my phone so I have to do the same thing. Oh yes, I have a iPhone 5 and unfortunately, the designers of this car didn't think this was a popular enough product to have it work with the voice activation dialling so there is no connection so you can use your phone. Yes, you can dump the contacts into the system's address book but because the voice prompts are impossible to use, don't even think of using the contact list unless you are stopped at a light. Had it back to the dealer to see if they could fix some of this and they did a 'reset' of the system. Made no difference to these problems. You have 5 'speed dial' numbers you can use. After that, you have to use voice prompts to get to the rest of your speed dials and once again, 'good luck' getting the voice prompts to work. I use to love the NAV system and how I could 'search' ahead to look at alternative routes using the toggle (joystick). Now, the system is so crazy that it when you toggle you move around the map so far that you can't pinpoint anything. Easy button controls on all of my past 4 MDX's have been easy to use. Now replaced by a touch screen that is cumbersome, slow and unnecessary. If this was the only shortfall, I could get use to it. The system is also VERY SLOW. Slow to enter addresses, slow to start up, slow to react when you go through the screens or try to enter an address. Car handles pretty well. Not as aggressive as previous versions but still pretty decent. BE VERY CAREFUL. THIS CAR WILL DRIVE YOU NUTS if you are use to the 'easy to use' electronics of previous versions of this car. My wife drives a Mercedes GLK. I use to hate the NAV system on that car. Now I think the MDX designers have found a way to make it tougher. Sad that they have taken a fantastic car and really destroyed it. I had a 'loaner' 2013 TL from my dealer a few weeks ago. It was very frustrating to remember how easy the system use to be prior to the 2014 model.

reviews.title: excellent so far
reviews.review_text: I had this truck for 2 months now and I love it. This is the best midsize luxury suv I have ever driven. It has a smooth ride and a powerful 300 hp engine and it is very spacious. Although the the third row seats might not be as adult friendly as my mountaineer it is perfect for the kids. Gas mileage is great for a midsize suv and it's great being that gas prices are up and down I won't need to worry about spending to much. I also love the features such as XM. radio, rear back up camera, DVD entertainment, navigation system and much more. And I got all of this for just a little under 50 grand. If you are looking for a great truck that is full of luxury and can take you places in style then take a look at the Mdx.

reviews.title: Fabulous midsize SUV; excellent value
reviews.review_text: I'm extremely happy w/ my 2013 MDX. The handling, acceleration, and smoothness are equal to Mercedes or Lexus. The interior comfort, though slightly cramped on my 6'1" frame, is top notch, as is the design and efficiency of all the controls and their placement. I've carried 6 passengers very comfortably and my kids (13 & 18) are pleased w/ the rear seats and leg room . For me it far surpassed all competition in its price range (Jeep, GMC Acadia, etc). I prefer the previous models' body style, but this one is handsome enough for me. My only complaints (minor) are 1) the features and integration of the Tech Package (Navigation, Audio, Blue Tooth, Voice Commands, Reverse camera, etc) are truly incredible, but its fairly complicated to learn all the commands and how to switch back and forth (and I'm very tech savvy) 2) I thought the car came with remote ignition (which I really miss) and a roof rack (which I also miss). I probably should've been more vigilant prepurchase, but I also wish the salespeople had made this clearer. I'm looking at an additional 1.5K to add these features which were standard on many of the other cars I shopped.

reviews.title: So Far So Great!
reviews.review_text: A few weeks ago I purchased a 2013 Acura MDX. Although it's far too early to know for sure, so far the vehicle has been pretty darn great! As far as "likes" the vehicle looks sharp...sound system is exceptional...hands free is really nice...the ride is extremly comfortable...the acceleration is perfect for all driving requirements and the handling is very responsive. Lots of techie type buttons that I'm gradually learning, but I'm sure in a few more weeks I'll have everything nailed down. As far as "dislikes" not too sure I'm going to enjoy having to put premium gasoline in the tank over the long haul, but it is what it is...wish they had a couple more cup holders in the front...and the third row seating doesn't have a lot of room. Short trips or with children no problem. Long trips would be another story. The Acura people from the salesperson, sales manager, service personnel have all been wonderful. Extremely responsive before, during and even after I forked over the cash for the MDX. Hopefully, the so far so great turns into a 4 or 5 year fantastic purchase!

reviews.title: Engine eats oil.
reviews.review_text: I recently bought a used 2012 Acura MDX to replace a 2007 MDX. Had high expectations for the car until the first 2000 miles passed. - THEN the Check Oil at dealer warning came on. Very long story short. Thought at first the prior owner had not serviced the oil and engine properly - but NO - the engine is well-known by owners and Acura to have a defect in the ring/cylinder design that causes a VERY high oil consumption. Like a quart every 1000 miles. Acura issued a Technical Service Bulletin in July 2016 about dealers providing "goodwill consideration" in trying to appease irate owners. Long story short: They changed the engine design to have a certain aluminum coating in the cylinders - and the rings wear out from abrasion with the finished cylinder. There are attempts at getting a class-action lawsuit by a legal firm - and not sure where that will end up - but I've already registered with the law firm. The J37A engine is the consistent problem - in other Acura models as well. Solution: trade the car or replace the engine. Not a pretty picture. So I am trading ASAP. Heavier oil than the recommended 5W-20 could cause far greater issues in the engine. Statistics are showing that over 11% of the J37A engines have SEVERE oil consumption issues - rumor has it that rings were installed incorrectly at the factory. My 2007 MDX had a different version of the engine and never used oil. They changed to the J37A in 2008 and continued with it through at least 2014. I have no idea how reviewers have missed this - especially Consumer Reports. Acura is claiming it is normal to add a quart of oil at 1000 miles. Right...!

I wanted a 7 seat luxury SUV and the MDX was perfect. My wife thought the Lexus 7 seater was too boxy, as was the MB. The BMW X5 was not a comfort vehicle, and so the MDX was perfect. I'm really amazed at the price/luxury ratio.

reviews.title: Can't beat this vehicle

It is comfortable, the ergonomics inside are just right, it is not too big and not too small, it is nimble and very confident in fast turns, and drives smaller than it is with plenty of power. Areas where it needs improvement are unacceptable MPG(21 on the highway), some road noise in coarse surfaces, and taut ride that sometime borders on nervous. The grille is another story, but after looking at it a couple of times you get used to it. It seems they could not come up with anything else distinctive.

reviews.title: What are they thinking?
reviews.review_text: Fuel efficiency unacceptable. Why not at least use cylinder deactivation like on Pilot. Why not diesel? New VW/Audi diesel significantly better at motivating this much tonnage, efficiency about a third better. Voice technology terrible, useless, must learn the Acura language. Blue tooth phone link also useless since sound is so bad can't have a conversation. Rattles, luxury Japanese autos should not. Lots of rattles some almost seem to be intentionally designed into the vehicle like the rattle that comes from the passenger seat belt receptacle or the one that comes from the top of where the 2nd row seat splits. AC and fan direction hidden when you turn on HVAC. Why? This is a distraction. Buttons are very hard to navigate like they want to force you to use the horrible voice activation system. Distraction. No interest in the car choosing the fan speed for me when I want to defrost the front windshield, sometimes I just need a little air flow, not gale force winds. Can't shut the 2 middle vents in front. Really? Fake wood is bearable but positioned so you get blinded by sun's reflection for prolonged periods when driving NE or making left turns. They can't figure out a rain sensing windshield wiper system? In California you must have your headlights on when your windshield wipers are in use. They can't program the "auto" switch on the headlight control to make the headlights turn on when the windshield wipers are in use. No, that would be intelligent, even luxurious. No power folding mirrors? Really? Interior is pretty nice and comfortable other than horrible control layout. It's been known for decades that knobs are better than buttons at things like changing temperature and fan speed. With a knob I could just go from zero fan speed to 1, or 2, etc., without having to verify on the tiny screen (no ON/OFF button required). Same with temperature, could just twist a knob if I'm too warm or cold not have too look over and down taking my eyes off the road. Why not show changes on the NAV/infotainment screen? Transmission wants to up-shift as early as possible to save gas I guess. This makes the downshift paddle necessary but the up-shift paddle unused. Tranny could probably use a few more gears but it is smooth except when you roll a stop and it clunks down when you hit the gas. Sport mode is pretty good. If the car didn't drive better than 95% of all other SUV's with 3 rows of seats I would call it a total loss.

reviews.title: decent
reviews.review_text: This is a good car if you are looking to haul kids around, but anything more than that is not so good. First of all, the exterior design is very bland. It does not scream high-end like the price tag suggest. It is much easier to find better looking cars in the same price range, and class. (ex. Porsche Cayenne, Range Rover, Audi Q7, Lexus RX, and the BMW X5.) The interior design is just as bland, the leather and materials are nice and luxurious, but the technology is abysmal. To even get a screen in the car you have to get a technology package. However, there is a back-up camera that is conveniently hidden in the rear view mirror. The car comes with a big 3.7L V6 that is very punchy and decently responsive. But beware, this car gets horrible gas mileage (averaging around 17mpg with normal driving). One thing I absolutely hate about this car is the terrible transmission. It always seems to be in too high a gear and is extremely slow to respond. It is not even worth using the paddle shifters, because they either take too long to respond or just don't except your shift. However, the reliability has been very good, driving 50k miles the only major repair (besides oil changes) has been the timing belt that went out at 90k and cost 900 dollars.

reviews.title: Staunch American Car owner in a Japanese car...
reviews.review_text: Always had American cars: Chrysler, Mercury, Pontiac, Chevy. So when it was time to give away my 2010 Chevy Impala which I've had at 0 miles I of course was looking at new cars: Ford Taurus, Mustang and Fusion, Chevy Camaro and Impala, Dodge Charger and Challenger. Wife saw this used certified 2011 MDX, I balked at her idea. "Really? Me in a non-American car? Don't think so," I thought. But I had to humor her like a good hubby and went to look at it for a test drive. Dang! Not only did it have all the features I was looking for (leather seats, dual climate control, Bluetooth connection for the phone) it had some extras I wasn't really looking for (sun roof, heated seats, backup camera, 3rd row seating)! But, I figured "It's an SUV, it'll be slow as molasses. That is until the dealer told me, "Go ahead, put it into sports mode and open it up." I did and was surprised at the zippy pick up it has! On top of that being certified it still had part of the original warranty and an extra year/12000 miles added to it! Logically, as much as I reeeeeeeeealllllllyyyyy wanted an American car, for the value of the MDX I couldn't turn it down (would have been crazy to do so!). So here I am, a staunch all American car gung-ho driver in a Japanese luxury suv enjoying every bit of it. Side note: My 2010 Impala is still kicking, gave it to my brother as a gift since his only car (a VW) was totaled and he and his wife have 2 kids.

reviews.title: We bought another MDX

Another reviewer really summed up my primary complaint and that focuses on the instrument panel. The speedometer is difficulty to read because the steering wheel blocks my vision at the position that is comfortable for me to drive. The fuel gauge is virtually out of sight and hidden in the recesses of the circular forms that are part of the panel design. I much prefer the trip information on the 2005; and as the other reviewer noted I am not much interested in the most accessible options. I want to know what my gas mileage is instantly and over a period of miles. That is not easily accessed as it is with the 2005. reviews.title: 2011 MDX Technology
reviews.review_text: Needed a sooner than expected replacement after my 2005 X5 3.0 got totalled in an accident. After looking at 2012 X5, 2011 Q7 and MDX I ended up purchasing an MDX and my findings are based on two months of usage. Performance: In terms of performance I did not feel a lot different than the X5 (I had low expectations going into the MDX), of course the steering feel is no where close to the X5 and it took a while to get used when making turns and parking. Brakes felt good and there was enough engine power when needed and you can actually feel the SH-AWD working when the torque moves to the external wheel during curves/turns. There is a little wind noise at higher speeds but it not too bad and seemed normal and with the sound system you do not feel it much. Driving in all the rain we got in Chicago past few weeks was never a problem and the MDX handled exceptionally except for the lack of rain sensing wipers. Technology Package: If you have longer commutes or a music buff, opt for the technology package and you will not be disappointed. The sound output is amazing and I did not have trouble connecting my iPhone on Bluetooth and connecting an older iPod using the USB/AUX. There are a few minor issues like it would not store mp3 cds on the built in hard disk. Only audio CDs get ripped on to the hard disk. The backup camera is pretty useful. The voice recognition for music search and navigation works good though I cannot say the same about the navigation software. Having got used to google, I found searching for locations difficult since it does not sort by distance (maybe there is an option and I have not explored it) and I end up searching on my iPhone and then inputting the address. Interior: Needed a 7 seat option because of pressure from the wife and kids. Kids like the third row but there are no ac vents in the third row. Getting in is a challenge for adults like all three row SUVs and my daughter likes to climb in through the trunk and use one seat in the third row. The driver and passenger seats are extremely comfortable and the leather feels nice but seats could be more supportive. The second row middle seat for anyone more than average height would be inconvenient for the passenger because he would be seeing directly into the rear view mirror and the blacked out portion of the windshield. Its also inconvenient for the driver because the entire view would be blocked. The room between the rear headrests and ceiling seems less than normal and it took a while to get used to the rear visibility which was a little annoying. The gauges are a little crowded and I could never see the full fuel gauge in whatever position I adjust the seat or the steering. The wiper stalk was always coming in the way. Probably Acura would make them cleaner in the next version. The reviews said too many buttons but I got used to them. Like for example in the X5 reducing the fan speed all the way would switch it off and they just have two buttons, but in the MDX there is a button for on and off for the fan apart from the two buttons for increasing and decreasing the fan speed. Its more of user experience thing and nothing more. Hope you go the point. Exterior: I am hoping someone at Acura design got fired for all the beak grills they have. I just wish they hired better designers maybe they were trying to cut down costs and had the Honda designer multi tasking. The front grill is difficult to get used however I look at it. Maybe the 2009 grill was better. Other than that it looks sleek and does not feel like a 7 seater. I got the black roof rails and rack just to make it look like an SUV. I wrote more about the things that I did not like so people can make informed decision if that is something they care for. It does not mean I did not like the car. MDX is one of the best luxury damily SUVs and all I can say is for the money it is the best 7 seat SUV that you can get. Similarly equipped X5s (I could not find many 7 seaters even though I wanted to buy an X5) and Q7s were atleast 10k more and of course you get more prestige with them. I saved the 10k and will see how long I can resist to stay away from a BMW.

reviews.title: Best Car Ever?
reviews.review_text: Our family has purchased several Toyotas over the years; their value and low maintenance override the slightly higher cost over similar models of their competitors. I have checked "5 stars" for reliability because this site requires an answer; we have only had this car a few months, but records show zero problems with the car per dealership that owned this car previously. Our last purchase was a Toyota Camry, which was a dependable and reliable road car; but it was just not as comfortable as the Avalon. With the increased back seat space and slightly larger overall interior space, more comfortable seats, and the legendary Avalon headroom, I can drive comfortably all day, in style, even though I am 6'3" and have established myself generously beyond the 200 lb. mark. The front wheel drive, 3.5 liter V-6 with its 6 forward speed automatic transmission combine to give this car a quick boost when passing uphill; in fact, a step on the accelerator pushes you back in your seat like a race car. Our road mileage is about 28 mpg, despite the fact that this sold to us by a dealer who used it as a loaner car. Our particular car is loaded to the hilt with accessories, including Elaine the Electric lady (a GPS based talking trip adviser), who has made our travels to unknown (or forgotten) destinations a real joy. We are very pleased with the vehicle and outstanding price, as advertised on Cars.com. The 131 mile trip to an out of town dealer was well worth it; we would have traveled twice that distance for this car at the price we paid. It has become our favorite family car of all time (married 38 years); beautiful, powerful, comfortable, sleek and (so far) totally reliable; the hallmark of this carmaker's products. In fact, after researching the various cars through Consumer Reports and elsewhere for the last 3 years, we found the best car at any price. This car and model are a true winner in all respects.

I have not had any service issues and do not expect to. I would encourage anyone to drive and consider an Acura.

reviews.title: The best premium SUV you can buy!
reviews.review_text: I sold my E Class Merc and bought the "base" 2010 MDX. Having owned many quality vehicles, including 7 SUV's over the past 20 years, in my opinion, the MDX is the best I have owned. Quality, finish, performance and features are outstanding. This SUV is so much fun to drive, in a world full of bland vehicles. AWD and exceptional braking make it ultra safe. Unless you really need the nav and MP3 features, the base model is a very good choice. You can hardly call a vehicle that has a rear camera, power tail-lift, power/heated leather seats, voice controlled Bluetooth, CD changer, moon roof and much more a base model! Front seats are superb. Middle row (reclines) is excellent. Third row is for kids or small adults only. I also personally like the styling very much. One thing I really like is that although this is a big vehicle, it does not feel or look like a van. Some SUV's are beginning to look like vans. I thoroughly recommend this vehicle.

It was ALMOST PERFECT, except for a few things Acura could have done better on. First, the price is almost as expensive as the TL. It's got to be at a cheaper price point to the TL with the same engine. Then the Navigation system. The NAV in the TSX is pathetic and small and dim compared to the beautiful one in the TL. They should make the NAV's the same. And lastly, Acura needs to come out with a V6 TSX Type-S. Something just a little bit sportier than the bland, pure vanilla, V6 they offer now. In summary, it is a really good car now with the V6, but with just a few more changes, it can become GREAT!! Hope this helps.

I believe the MDX just might provide the best value of all SUV's or crossovers. Our base model is well worth the price. The interior is quite plush and very comfortable and the technology is unsurpassed. It handles like a much smaller vehicle and provides the comfort and convenience of a much more expensive one. I don't know what else I could ask for. The only thing I miss from the X3 is the heated steering wheel. The lease deals on the MDX are MUCH better than the X3 as well. If you're in the market for a high-end SUV don't buy until you've tried this one. It's all you could want for less.

reviews.title: Not a city SUV
reviews.review_text: If you are looking for an SUV that has quick pickup and response this is not your SUV. MDX is rated very high, but I am disappointed by its performance. We noticed that there is a delay in pickup and acceleration. In our typical DC commute, we want to change lanes quickly and takeoff. I noticed that there is a drag/delay with MDX that is quite frustrating when you try to accelerate from a signal, stop sign or change lanes. Acura added a lot of control buttons that will confuse almost every one. It will take you a while to see external temperature, reset your trip meter etc. Even the radio does not display station names or song titles. (My 2004 minivan does!). The Navigation system is not very friendly either. My $150 Garmin will display speed limits and street view, where as Acura's do not. There are other irritations too. If you open the sun-glass holder, the glass will fall right down because of the door position (very silly). The ride once you are on a steady speed is good and it handles the road and turns very well. I liked the 3rd row seat.

reviews.review_text: Absolutely love everything there is to the MDX from the exterior to the interior. Everything about the MDX is worth your buck.

reviews.title: Acura MDX 2008
reviews.review_text: Acura MDX 2008 Model has been the best car that i have used so far with the 3.7 liter V6 Engine, the power by the beast and superb mileage for 20 MPG in City and 25 MPG in Highway

reviews.title: 2008 MDX Elite
reviews.review_text: I recently purchased a 2008 Acura MDX with 171,000 miles on it. I would trust this car anywhere. I traded in my 2007 Honda Civic and the only thing I miss is the mpg. The MDX has great options and is very stylish. I looked at many SUVs before purchasing the MDX including Highlander, Explorer, Sorento, Santa Fe, and Pilot. The only ones that even came close to the MDX was the Highlander and Pilot (which is the Honda that the MDX is based off of). Would definitely recommend to anyone young or old. Heck I'm 16 and I love it.

reviews.title: Best car I've owned!
reviews.review_text: I love my mdx. It runs smooth it's luxury and fast great truck worth every penny I paid for it. If you are looking into getting the mdx my advice is GO FOR IT!

reviews.title: MDseXy
reviews.review_text: This was my first car and it has been amazing. It wont crash, its quick, not many people have it. Its high quality luxury for a first car. I just inherited it from my mother. It has been used in mission trips, driven cross the country, left in the sun for weeks at a time and I've given it a beating. The rear view camera has saved many a dogs life. Rain and snow are nothing. the only problem is.. gas mileage. You have to use the premium gas and frankly, a teenager that refs cant afford a 15 mpg weekly fill-up. Primary use: everything any vehicle can do, it does acceptionally well. Tows our boat.

reviews.title: my first luxury suv
reviews.review_text: Great car! My family loves the comfortable roomy interior. Absolutely no complaints. Awesome vehicle. Purchased from K&G Motors in Mason Ohio at almost wholesale.

reviews.title: Awesome Vehicle
reviews.review_text: Fantastic value! For the luxury, fit & finish, and performance.... you cannot beat the MDX for a 7-passenger vehicle!

reviews.title: Comfortable, fun to drive SUV
reviews.review_text: Great vehicle....works for the family or as a commuter...plenty of space and leg room (except for the 3rd row seating). Comfortable, good features, drives beautifully. The ride is more of a sports suspension type of comfort rather than a luxury vehicle. Good performer. Fun to drive. My kids love it too!

reviews.title: Great Roadtrip Car
reviews.review_text: I went from a 05 Infiniti G35 to the 08 MDX to accomodate my 3 kids when we travel. The kids love it. It's comfortable with lots of leg room. My 5yr old love the 3rd row seat. I highly recommend this car for family with small children. The only bad thing I would say about this car is the gas mileage on it when I'm driving in the city. Other than that it's wonderful!

reviews.title: Great SUV
reviews.review_text: Excellent all around suv...fast and sure handling. Exterior styling leaves something to be desired and gas mileage not favorable.

reviews.title: 102k and trans going
reviews.review_text: Bought my used 2008 mdx thinking it would last forever. Then find out trans was going at 102k miles. Traded it in. Not worth the $3500 after i found out out that the design of the teans in the mdx is not built to holdup for the long haul. Believe me i loved everthing else on this car but didnt feel like an ongoing large investment.

reviews.title: MDX - I'm loving it
reviews.review_text: Purchased a 2008 MDX a little over a month ago but have been putting it through its paces and love it! The body style has changed slightly since 2008, have added a roof rack and will be adding running boards soon. Needed a vehicle with 3rd row seating, luxury feel and good resale without being to big or truck like for my wife to feel comfortable driving. This is a perfect fit! Handles great, quick, love the AWD. We took it on a road trip 3 weeks in and it was so comfortable and nice for a 1,000 mile drive. The MDX looks great, drives great, handles, and comes equpeed. After MUCH searching it was a no-brainer. I also considered BMW X5 and Audi Q5 and Q7.

reviews.title: Stylish Reliability.
reviews.review_text: I purchased this car two months ago and love it. I wish it were a little larger in the trunk area, but overall I am completely satisfied. With the Acura reputation for reliability, what's not to love.

reviews.title: awesome car
reviews.review_text: best car ever. i love this car!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!THIS IS THE PERFECT CAR FOR A 4-7 PEOPLR FAMILY.

reviews.title: Wife's Car
reviews.review_text: Purchased an 08 MDX, with 45K on it, drives like a dream, has Nav., DVD in the rear, and the power tail gate. Seats are very comfortable, the heated seats are wonderful, not too hot, just right! My wife loves being seated higher than the 4 door Infiniti that we had. The controls are placed in very good positions, and the suv has no rattles or noises at all. Going down the highway, the car is very quiet, all in all a very nice suv, just wish it got a little better gas mileage.

reviews.title: Excellent Vehicle
reviews.review_text: MDX is a phenomenal vehicle. Luxurious, great performance for an SUV, reliable, and about the best resale value you can find. Third seat is not very accessible when 2 carseats are in 2nd row.

reviews.title: O.K. car
reviews.review_text: We almost bought one. On the way to the dealer we stopped to look at a Volvo XC90. Wow what a car. The Volvo in consumer report had a lower rating and that is why we did look at them, but I am glad we did. The XC90 just felt safe. The MDX felt light and we did not want our children in it. We have had our XC90 now for one year and it is just great.

reviews.title: Great Car
reviews.review_text: This is a Car any Guy could love. It has great handling and the best inside on any car that I have owned. The only things I would improve on would be the steering wheel rim is too thin needs to be thicker, and for a car that cost $50,000 It should have push button starting other Acura's have this feature why not the MDX! I have the Sport package on the new one they call it the advanced package it comes with the active shocks, this is the the best thing about this car, I drove a 2010 loaner car without it and that thing was like driving a ocean liner, the system cuts out almost all body roll and make the car handle like a sports car.

reviews.title: Aucra MDX
reviews.review_text: I have a 2008 and I love this SUV. I've owned a Highlander, Explorer and a Redeo and this truck is by far the best. Granted it is a better quality to begin with. Handling for a SUV is great. Fast, comfortable and gets 21MPG combined city/highway around Tysons Corner VA.

reviews.title: 2nd MDX, 2nd Gen overhaul
reviews.review_text: Upgraded my wife to this from her 2003 MDX Touring. Expected it to be much the same except newer. In some ways it is, but in other ways it is quite a revelation. Handling is terrific, like a 5,000lb version of my wife's previous BMW 3-Series. Very crisp, makes our old one feel like a mini-van in comparison. VERY comprehensive & sophisticated electronics package (DVD video, DVD audio, MP3 player, surround sound, BT phone integration, etc. Possibly overkill, but great for gadget freaks. Originally upgraded my wife to this to haul the babies around, but she thinks it is so pretty and pristine that she's relegated them to her old (my new hand-me-down) MDX. So what was supposed to be the new family car has instead become her personal styl'n ride. Jeez I'm a great husband, should get an award or something. Wish it worked better with iPhone though :-( I understand they've greatly improved that in the latest 2010 version.

reviews.title: Disapointed
reviews.review_text: Was excited to own this car, after great reviews, but should have done more research. Passenger seat, little leg room, knees hit dasboard. Second row seat very tight. Third row seat, only for young children. Very rough ride. Vibration at high speed, not able to fix. Very costly for maintenance, needs service often. Not a luxury car. Positives: lots of options, easy to park, can fit 3 boosters in second row, holds value.

reviews.title: So far Perfect
reviews.review_text: I had my MDX for 2 years now, and so Far Love it. Love all the Features the easy Navigation, Stereo System, the Remote Control Left gate, I am also starting to use many of the Voice commands(very Cool. I had no issues with my MDX at all. the Super handling 4 wheel drive system is GREAT and sure footed on Colorado Snow and Icee roads. I learned to trust this SUV in adverse weather conditions.

reviews.title: FORGET MERCEDES ACURA IS THE MOST TECH 4YOUR MONEY
reviews.review_text: I HAVE DRIVEN BMW, MERCEDES, FOR YEARS GREAT CARS BUT A HEFTY PRICE, IN THESE TOUGH TIMES ACURA MDX IS THE SMART CHOICE WITH TECHNOLOGY ,CONFORT,HANDELING AND ABOVE ALL A HEAD TURNER WITHOUT THE HEFTY PRICE TAG.I LOVE MY ACURA MDX AND LOVE THE PRICE TAG EVEN MORE DEFINETLY A SMART BUY.

reviews.title: Awesome!!!!!!
reviews.review_text: I have owned a 2000 Lexus RX 300, 2004 Acura MDX, 2006 Toyota 4 Runner and now the 2008 Acura MDX for a month and I love the car since I first had it as a loaner. It is a vast improvement over the previous MDX models (prior to 2007). The handling, speed and interior design are awesome. Love the manual/automatic transmission. The sound system, navigation system and HFL are also extraordinary. Would buy this car again in a heartbeat and would recommend this vehicle to anyone who loves driving and wants an awesome (did I use this word yet?) experience!

reviews.title: Most Techno Fun Car Ever Owned
reviews.review_text: Bought a 2008 MDX Tech/Entertainment package after an 2003 Audi A6 with many problems. Acura is a great car with more positives than negatives about it. Very quiet including road noise for a Honda product(I also own Toyota's) and loads of fun to drive. The technology in this car is fantastic. The ELS sound system is awesome but good luck finding DVD-Audio discs to bring it to the full potential!! Bluetooth works great, Nav system is very cool. There are alot of buttons in this car but very easy to navigate around. The engine is a little lagging on the low end torque but the more I drive it the more power it seems to get. Handles great with no body roll at all. Our 6 person family fits in it quite well, looks small on the outside but very big inside. I only have 2 complaints with the car. The rear suspension is noisy when going over bumps, kind of a thunking noise that I didnt notice on the test drives. Once you spend time in it you will know what I'm talking about, big flaw for a luxury vehicle! The other is a poor designed steering wheel, from the shape, the lack of tilting/telescoping enough leads to uncomfortable hand/arm placements for long road trips. I'm 6ft tall and the wheel doesnt drop low enough and come close enough. You end up raising the seat height to accomodate after awhile, bad design indeed and my wife agrees. Oh yeah, one other thing, don't put anything that can melt in the center console, it cooks in there. Overall great car but it should be for the big price tag! Tried other cars in this class but there was really no comparison. Ive always good luck with my Honda's in the past so I'm hoping Acura is even better.

reviews.title: The Ultimate driving machine !
reviews.review_text: I am very hard to please driver , I did drive Mercdes M, BMW X5, and other SUV , By far this is the best driving machine ! It combined easy handling (when driven by my wife)and will satisfy the aggresive driver as well . The sound system is superior, I actually enjoy it more than my Bose surround system at home , It is packed with so many advanced tech features that is not even advertised by Acura !! I feel lucky having taken that test drive , I ended up in getting the 2008 MDX with sport/techn/ rear DVD , my only take on Acura is that the parking sensors are not standard ..but even after spending $600 on these sensors , Its an excellen deal . even compared with other SUVs in the $$75,000 range ...

reviews.title: The ACURA MDX is a keeper!
reviews.review_text: I owned 2 BMWs before the Acura. While I really enjoyed my 3 series Bimmer and X3, I have got to admit the Acura MDX is in a class of its own. It is the best value for money and comes with sufficient label prestige to boot. When I signed on the dotted line for the Acura, I felt I was giving up some prestige going from the Bimmer to the Acura, but that lasted only till I left the dealership and drove home. The first ride made me forget my buyers remorse and I was all excited to show of my new toy. The ELS surround sound is the best I have heard in a car! I consider myself an audiophile and have a 3 dedicated 7.1 systems (Canton, Klipsch and Sunfire systems) in my house complete with a home theater but when it comes to car audio this one takes the cake! If you are thinking about an SUV this should be on your list to test drive.

reviews.title: Running Strong at 13 Years Old!
reviews.review_text: I had always wanted an MDX since they first premiered but could not afford one. When the style changed around 2006/2007 I was sold but still could not afford one. Right before the end of 2014 I had the opportunity to buy a 2007 model but it had 140,000 miles and a couple of minor problems. I went with my gut thinking that I would drive it a year or two and then trade it for something else. It's now March 2020 and I still own this vehicle. 140,000 miles have turned into 255,000 with no end in sight. Yes, there are regular maintenance concerns and I have probably pumped $7,000 into it over time but the original deal still makes this a tremendous value. Regular maintenance and careful driving will make sure these cars last well beyond their expected life. I would find it hard to give this car up or switch to a different model entirely.

reviews.title: Best car I ever bought.
reviews.review_text: This suv drives like a sports car. It handles and has lots of power. I bought it last year and it was a one owner car and was taken care of. She was elderly and serviced it regularly. It is such a great ride and I hope that it will last me a very long time because I enjoy driving it.

reviews.title: Great car
reviews.review_text: I cant find 25 words but I will say the car is reliable for the most. Yes! Its reliable, good space, but maintenance can be a bear. But for the perks its worth every cent.

reviews.title: Practical but Fun To Drive
reviews.review_text: Drives great, not as cumbersome as most SUV's I've driven, and it has a ton of space and AWD. The interior is very comfortable and user-friendly. I love it! My only negative would be that since it has very early bluetooth, you can't actually play music through it, you can only make calls, and you have to set up the voice recognition in the car itself to call numbers, rather than it using your phone to do all that. But that's not a big deal at all, just something to note. You can always use a bluetooth receiver or an aux cable.

reviews.title: So Far So Good
reviews.review_text: The vehicle is luxurious, stylish, and easy to drive. The interior is extremely roomy even with utilizing the third row. I often take my vehicle on long trips (2.5 - 8 hours) and I am never uncomfortable. Driving is so smooth, I must constantly look at the speedometer to ensure I am not speeding. I love my Acura MDX!

reviews.title: I love it!!
reviews.review_text: I bought this car because I have 3 children and I wanted a nice suv to make sure that were comfortable. This car has exceeded my expectations. Comfort and reliability is perfect I love this car

reviews.title: First Acura to own
reviews.review_text: I LOVE this car. I was lucky enough to buy it used, had one owner the whole time before who serviced it regularly. I expect to have a long life with it, unless I trad it in later for newer model. I LOVE the comfort, looks, and handling.

reviews.title: Great Car
reviews.review_text: This vehicle was an amazing car that I was very sad to let go. I just sold it yesterday because we bought a new car and had to trade it in.
