reviews.title: Major Problem with the Air Conditioner System
reviews.review_text: The ACURA MDX is one of the best cars in its class. It handles the road well, has plenty of cargo space, and its good on gas. The problem is when something does go wrong, Acura maintenance and repair garages are subpar. I worked with two different dealerships and Acura Care Relations for months trying to get my air conditioner to work, after months of back and forth (air conditoning not cooling the car), I had to get rid of the car. Good car overall, but terrible service. Oh, Acura offered a refund of my repair cost...I haven't received it yet.

reviews.title: Family workhorse wih comfort and style
reviews.review_text: This mid size SUV has a lot to offer for anyone wanting a people mover (7 seats) and functional family workhorse. It looks great for a night on the town and has a very comfortable ride (my wife loves driving it). It has been fantastic on family road trips (technology package including wireless headphones are perfect with kids). It has good towing capacity (boat and small to mid sized campers; we also use rear hitch bike rack) and interior rear carrying with seats down. It has run very reliably (the engine sounds like a clock with hood up) with routine and expected maintenance at the usual mileage milestones. There are several decent competitors in this segment but I have never regretted the purchase and would consider buying again, new or used!

reviews.title: Acura MDX is stylish, smart and very reliable
reviews.review_text: This vehicle has been a very reliable and dependable one. Just fuel, start and you are ready to go besides the mandatory services i.e oil change and minor replacement of front suspension parts considering the roads.

reviews.title: Perfect size and you also get a 3rd row! Luxury.
reviews.review_text: This is the first time we've ever owned an Acura. I've been pleasantly surprised. I previously had 2 Toyota Sequoia's. Sequoia's are my all-time fav vehicle, but I wanted to somewhat downsize. The MDX was a perfect fit because it allowed me to downsize from the huge Sequoia, but I didn't lose anything as far as vehicle quality. I do have to say that I'm VERY surprised that Acura/Honda didn't make this luxury vehicle to have mostly luxury options. For instance, the rear view mirror is not auto-dimming, and it does NOT even have the compass on it. Heck, my 2004 Toyota Sequoia even had that! I feel that they should've put in a V8 engine like the Sequoia's have. The Sequoia has MUCH more punch when putting the pedal to the medal. But instead, Acura puts in a V6 that REQUIRES you to use expensive premium fuel. Yes, it's NOT an option. The manual says you must use premium fuel or it will cause engine problems. The sunroof button is not very user friendly. Until you've had the car for awhile and get used to what the picture means on the button, you'll be fumbling with it like I still do after 3 months. :) The 2nd row could use better quality cup holders in the arm rest. The 3rd row could use better storage and cup holder options also. I ABSOLUTELY love the trim look and storage options in the front seat. It looks VERY sharp! You can even close a lid to hid the cup holders. I love that the console between the driver and passenger is also the armrest(s). Besides, separate arm rests always seem to crack because of your arms always being on them. Acura/Honda makes the console of very high quality materials and there's not a crack to be found from arms resting on it. The leather is VERY high quality. Not a crack to be found anywhere in this 2007 MDX! The 2nd row needs a console in the arm rest to give kids somewhere to put their stuff. Kids seem to stretch out the pockets on the back of the seats when they continually put stuff in them. I love that Sirius Satellite radio is an option on this vehicle! I've never had this before and I LOVE it. I need to renew quickly before my 3 mos. free subscription expires! I'd be lost without my HairNation and Ozzy's Boneyard stations!

reviews.title: The most value for the money for a luxury SUV
reviews.review_text: 2007 MDX is one of the best best value. The interior is nicely equipped. Very pleasant family car, especially with the technology+entertainment package. Auto dimming rear-view mirror and rain sensing vipers were dearly missed in this model.

reviews.title: truly bad customer service
reviews.review_text: MDX sticker bubbling on front grill. defective product? Luxury SUV? warranty-nope, too late to fix it, quote from dealership $600 ???

reviews.title: Saved my life
reviews.review_text: Five weeks ago I was T-boned by two other vehicles, one going in excess of 50 mph. The other two vehicles were totaled (one was an SUV. All of the other drivers were sent to the hospital in ambulances. I stood outside my vehicle, looking at the damage to my MDX - just the doors and tie rod. It cost $8,200 to fix my car, but it's good as new. Acura is a top notch model.

reviews.title: Acura letdown: How my MDX left me in shock
reviews.review_text: I purchased a 2007 MDX and, until, last week felt good about my vehicle. It has never "wowed" me as some of my previous Acuras had, but it was ok. I never felt it was quite worth the sticker price, but Acura had never let me down - until now. I am currently in a state of shock and dismay after learning last week that the clunking sound coming form my right front end is a defective strut. The vehicle does have 101k miles on it so strut replacement did not seem unreasonable. I also was told that my rear struts are "leaking" and need to be replaced. The shock and dismay occurred when I was told by my nice service advisor that the 2007-2013 MDXs with the active dampening suspension require "specialized" electronic struts. Replacing all four will run about $4200. That's right - over four grand for strut replacement!!! No OEM options either. I was and still am in shock, that is almost 10% of purchase price. I then asked what would the cost be to replace all four struts if my car were a 2006 MDX w/o that particular suspension system. He looked it up and quoted me $1650. Now, that is a reasonable and customary cost. What an unbelievable difference in cost of ownership. Also, I could not get a any answer to my questions about disconnecting the active suspension and putting regular, traditional, non electronic struts on the vehicle. I am between a rock and a hard spot. I have owned 6 Acuras, have regularly recommended them to family and friends. I never will again. I really feel duped and taken by this atricious pricing, and, what is clearly a drastically over engineered suspension system and poor design decision by Acura that has rendered the MDX is a ticking time bomb for owners. If you have one of these MDXs, GET RID OF IT before you are stuck with this cost. DON"T BUY USED unless you have a mechanic certify the struts have been replaced recently. I have been a loyal Acura owner, I think they need to reprice these replacements quickly as there are a lot of 2007-2013 MDXs on the road, and, along with incensing their owner community who are going to be stuck with outrageous repair bills, they are truly setting themselves up for severe damage to their brand. They have with me. I feel deceived. STAY AWAY from 2007-2013 MDX or risk a second mortgage to keep it running.

reviews.title: MDX a great buy
reviews.review_text: After months of research we opted to purchase a used MDX. Not only did the MDX get high marks with review companies (one non-profit), I spoke with several dealers and mechanics that all said the same: dollar for dollar the Acura is the best used luxury line available. Even with high miles it is nearly impossible to tell this MDX is nearly 8 years old. It handles more like a sports sedan than a smaller SUV. The only real knock is the 3rd row seating is smallish and should not be used for anyone over 5' 8" (my middle son's height). The mileage is better than most 6 cylinder engines and offers PLENTY of acceleration. I am looking forward to testing the SH-AWD in a Wisconsin winter. The controls are easy to read/relate and comfort was obviously considered in the design. All in all, it has been a great vehicle for the money spent.

reviews.title: My Favorite Vehicle
reviews.review_text: This car is quite the workhorse, and we have truly enjoyed owning it. My 2007 has 163,000 miles on it and is still running as well as it did when we first got it. It has seen plenty of service, from hauling our boat trailer around and long trips across the country, and everything has worked flawlessly. If you have the money to spend on a mid sized luxury SUV, look no further than this. The navigation system is simple and intuitive (way more so than my father's Audi A6), and all of the finish on the interior looks fantastic. Again, cannot recommend this SUV high enough. My mom loved hers so much that when she retired it (and gave it to me) she got a 2013 and is again in love with that.

reviews.title: 2010 Hyundia Elentra GLS
reviews.review_text: This is an amazing dealership with Excellent sales persons. The car that I bought is an amazing vehical with low mileage and low on gas. Highly recommended dealership in Roanoke VA.

reviews.title: Smaller but effecient sporty car
reviews.review_text: We were looking to downsize but still have a car large enough to fit our family. This 3 row car does and is powerful, too. Easily climbs hills without feeling sluggish. The steering is a little stiff. This used Acura MDX is like a luxury car without the luxury price. I smile as I approach my car in a parking lot because It's a joy to own.

reviews.title: Downhill After 60k Miles
reviews.review_text: I have had the car for 4 years. If I had written this review after 3, it would have received 4 STARS OVERALL and 5 for reliability. I have had all the scheduled maintenance done, and things went downhill a year ago after 60k miles. Something repeatedly drains the battery while in the off position without explanation. I don't leave lights on, and have been stranded over 10x. I have had the car routed to the dealer multiple times, and had the device manager to my house 3 times. The worst party is that I keep the jumper cables in the back, and when the battery is dead, there is no way to open the rear door. If I were agile, and could climb over seats, no big deal, But right after back surgery, not an option. Disappointed in my Acura Certified Used Car. This extended warranty doesn't do you any good if they can't address the problem.

reviews.title: MDX Let down
reviews.review_text: The Acura MDX by numerous report has been rated above average in reliability. I bought my 2007 MDX sport new and at first everything was fine. By the time I traded the vehicle, it was 5 years old and all 4 struts needed to be replaced over this time period, The car had only 34, 000 miles and the cost to replace the aforementioned was $4,600. The failures started at 14,000 miles and the dealership couldn't pin point the problem until it was out of warranty. I wouldn't recommend this vehicle to my worst enemy.

reviews.title: Watch out for struts
reviews.review_text: I bought my Acura MDX sport model new in 2007. My biggest complaint was that 3 of the struts failed after 36,000 miles and the forth was leaking. Naturally the car was out of warranty (4 years). I suspect they started to fail around 20,000 miles because the car made a weird sound when it hit a bump. the car was religiously maintained by the dealership and I relied upon them noticing any problems (big mistake), but they did notice it after the warranty expired. Also when the car was filled up with gasoline, you could hear it swishing in the tank. Either they don't have baffles in the tank design or the gas tank was defective. In case your interested, the replacement cost for one front strut is $1300.00. A word to the wise, if you purchase an MDX get an extended warranty and have it check out by and independent garage.

reviews.title: Truly a Treat
reviews.review_text: The body style 2007 to Present has really been redefined and although only minor differences to front and rear bumper / grill only occured till 2012, 80% of the vehicle is still untouched. LED lighting is another plus for the latest, but regardless body style is more or less the same. I must say it is a treat to drive, very smooth and quiet suspension, and the voice activated features is out of this world, like your own built in "SIRI". Highly recommended !

reviews.title: Most comfortable and reliable car...
reviews.review_text: Very nice looking, no wind noise, comfortable, all power with navigation. Acura stopped using OnStar for the new models, I miss it. Good traction with AWD and stability control is a plus. Not great on gas mileage and is a bit heavy power wise. Seats 7 comfortably, rear seat reclines slightly. Big plus, rear air and heated seats. DVD player makes it a nice ride.

reviews.title: 2007 MDX-exceeds expectations
reviews.review_text: Purchased bumper to bumper warranty. Very satisfied overall. Stereo excellent. XM a bonus. Mileage dropped from 21 mpg to 12.5 while towing golf cart on 5x10 trlr. Seats very confortable. Would have preferred driver arm rest as in Escallade. I am not using voice commands.

reviews.title: Great Used Car
reviews.review_text: Purhased a 2007 MDX in December 2008. It had 30,000 miles on it, I paid $28,000.00. The dealerhsip wanted $31,999.00, the sticker was $45,500.00 new. Runs great and reliable. Plenty of room on inside even though from outside it seems smaller. Great for lugging kids to travel sports both in and out of state. It is only average in the snow even though it is 4 wheel drive.

reviews.title: 2007 Acura MDX
reviews.review_text: I searched reviews and consumer reports for months looking for a bullet proof vehicle for my soon to be 16 year old daughter to learn to drive in. Now I'll have a hard time handing it over! The MDX drives like a much smaller vehicle. Agile and comfortable and if you have a large family and need space it can do that too with a 3rd row seat for 2, while still having room in the back for storage... I'd recommend it to anybody who need a tank that drives like a car.

reviews.title: Great SUV
reviews.review_text: The MDX is a great car. It's a huge step up from the RDX, which is also a great car. Performance, comfort and utility are all well balanced. As most of the Pro-Reviewers point out, the controls, buttons, and guages could be a little more intuitive, but once you figure out the "Acura" logic it becomes easier.

reviews.title: Acura MDX
reviews.review_text: This vehicle handels like a dream. It has power and is great in the snow. The interior with leather is very comfortable. The Nav's system works great and the hands free is a nice thing to have when driving.

reviews.title: Great vehicle
reviews.review_text: Great vehicle my wife loves it. She travels approximately 100 miles a day and is very happy that we buy the vehicle....

reviews.title: Loving my MDX
reviews.review_text: Purchased a prewowned 2007 MDX with 17K miles. The car drives great. It is a smooth, comfortable ride. It takes some getting use to if you are going from a car to an SUV. It is a bigger vechile and not as easy to park. I feel as though there are more blind spots. On the flip side, the car is much more roomy and the trunk and third row have been great for trips. I would highly recommend. The newer models may have fixed blindspots. I imagine this car only improves with newer models. I would purchase another.

reviews.title: the complete suv
reviews.review_text: its one of the best vehicle ive owned. this coming from a guy whohas had other suvs before like the nissan xterra landrover discovery 2004 model, ive owned sedans like audi a4. its a drivers suv and one truly enjoys cornering with its super handling awd. the one gripe i have is that most acura dealers are pedestrian in terms of offering good customer service and do the brand no justice. the best dealers are landrover dealers hands down. most un professional dealers ive met are from ford, vw and honda. the toyota dealers are by far much better. dvd read error seems pretty common for acura so make sure buy that extended warranty which will cover this expense (its around 700$ minimum to repalce the dvd unit) ive taken this car on numerous cross country high terrain road trips across sierras, rockies in worst conditions it handled so surefootedly that it gave me confidence to push it up the slopes with no after thought. it has five star crash ratings lower maintainence than mercedes, BMW, Audis. why pay more . one suggestion though acura should make this suv look more macho by getting rubbersied bull bars like they have in discovery(deer hazard) stock tires should be michleins latitude and not some hankook or falken etc

reviews.title: 2007 Acura MDX
reviews.review_text: It is excellent SUV for long drive. But I think cargo is small compared to Honda Pilot or Tayota Highlader.Also the leg space to rest the left leg for driver is not confortable for tall people over 6'.

reviews.title: Most Reliable Car!
reviews.review_text: Extremely nice vehicle! I enjoyed the vehcilce tremendously -- very smooth ride and extremly plush! The tech package is phenomenal -- wow! You much try it now!

reviews.title: The best SUV in the Market
reviews.review_text: I come from driving a Lexus RX330 and even that is a great truck nothing compare to the Acura MDX. When you drive the MDX you have much power and better handeling then most of the SUV in the market not to say that the MDX offers a seven pasenger seating witch is not available in most SUV. Also Consumer Report rated as one of the saftest SUV in the Market

reviews.title: Nice Sled
reviews.review_text: We've owned our MDX for two years now. Looks great. Drives great. Macho Styling. Sucks Fuel. Big Blind Spot. Great Audio. No major problems.. it could handle better at freeway speed. Not a Cheap Date. Very Safe and Fun to Drive. Buy one if you can afford the fuel and maintenance.

reviews.title: Nice features, boring drive.
reviews.review_text: Great features for the price, every option I could think of...but... Drove a BMW X5 4.4 then a 2007 MDX...what a difference in engine performance. The MDXs engine seems too small for the size of the vehicle, makes it boring to drive and slow. If your buying a car for the features, and technology, this car is for you....if you want performance...look elsewhere. After a year and a half of the MDX, I traded it in for a ML550, I could not live without a high powered engine !!

reviews.title: Fun, sporty and fun to drive.
reviews.review_text: I have driven this car over 15000 miles and I have to say I am satified with my purchase. The MDX is fun to drive and has plenty of get up and go for the average driver. Handling is very nice although a bit heavy for my wife. Styling is nice as well. We opted for the nav model, but would probably have purchased the base model after owning this one due to price. A portable nav is much cheaper and just as good. Yearly map upgrades for ours will be expensive. What we like: Great looks Fun to drive Good performance Excellent features Third row seats Front seat comfort Decent gas mileage All wheel drive works great Hands free calling is very cool and works well Nav screen is easy to read and located in the proper place What we do not like. Second row seats are comfortable but do not recline, they only tilt back slightly We had to purchase an auto dimming rear view mirror as it is not standard equipment Stereo is good but not great Somewhat noisy climate control fan Seats are not full leather, only the seating surfaces, however the third row seat does have leather surfaces unlike other brands Nav works well, but does not always show the shortest routes Voice recognition takes practice Fuel door release broke after a few months Overall we would probably purchase this car again. We did get a big surprise when we went to our insurance agent. We have an excellent rating, but it costs us about a grand more a year because of the luxury status. Also parts are very expensive, but because it is a Honda product, it should not break very often. I would take a hard look at the new Buick or the Mazda if I had to do it over again, but resale would probably make the MDX my choice once again because I will own this car well over 100,000 miles and do not want to give it away when I am finished like I do with most domestic brands.

reviews.title: Worth for the money.
reviews.review_text: The AWD system is really a very impressive technology that they put in this SUV.It feels like a sports car when it comes to cornering.

reviews.title: Value for the money.
reviews.review_text: Money for horse power ratio is very reasonable.The all new AWD system really works very good in handling curves and corner.Luxury car that is worth for the money.

reviews.title: Great value for luxury SportsUV
reviews.review_text: As a loyal BMW customer and previous owner of a 2002 X5, the MDX had big shoes that it would have to fill. Frequently I have needs for 5 to 6 passengers (1 or 2 of which are usually kids) and the 3rd row comes in quite handy for such times. I am quite impressed with the road manners of the MDX and would say that it handles as well as my X5 did. Steering is precise and it corners with confidence with the sport package equipped model. Seating is comfotable and provides all with plenty of space. The navigation system is first class and user friendly, however, the touch screen in my wife's Acura TL is even better. The rear seat DVD entertainment package is great for keeping the little ones occupied without hearing, "are we there yet?". The styling of the previous model was unimpressive and bland to me, but this one is bold and masculine, especially with the sport package rims and sport running boards. Acura has done a great job and I find this to be a great compliment to our 2004 Acura TL and 2006 BMW 330i.

reviews.title: BETTER THAN A BENZ!!!!
reviews.review_text: I traded my Mercedes E500 2003 for an ACURA MDX 2007............... (The BENZ kept breaking down),Mercedes had to put in a new transmission at 35k,a new Master brake cylinder at 37k,and all kinds of other issues,,what ever happened to MERCEDES-BENZ???,expensive JUNK! I test drove almost every SUV out there,ML350,RX350,BMWX5,4RUNNER,H3,etc and the ACURA MDX was the best by far!,(the BMW X5 was nice to but for almost 20k more! I did not think it was worth it) My wife ADORES the ACURA we will be driving it to Florida from NYC this year and putting her to the test,(the car not my wife,she already passed the test!). and in the RAIN it handles like a dream,LET IT SNOW!!! Check out the BOOK VALUE and the DEPRECIATION FACTOR in 3 years that is where its at!

reviews.title: An SUV that really drives like a car
reviews.review_text: Competes with the BMW X5 4.8i V8. The only major difference is price. I have driven this vehicle for over 2 weeks and love it.

reviews.title: 2007 Luxury SUV of the year!!! Thanks Acura!!
reviews.review_text: I recently purchased a 2007 MDX after researching all (and I mean ALL) luxury suv's with three rows of seating. This is the class leader Hands Down! I drive a Lexus and when my wife and I were planning on purchasing a new suv for her, we first looked at Lexus. I am a huge Lexus fan but they currently do not offer anything that can compete with the MDX in price and performance. Advice to Lexus: add a 3rd row to the RX for those of us who don't like truck like suv's but still need 5-7 seat capacity. I did exhaustive research on the X5, XC90, Audi, LR3, etc. etc. Nothing beat this vehicle. Don't get me wrong these other vehicles are nice but a X5, for example, would have set us back an additional $15-20K and still would not have a usable 3rd row (very tiny). The MDX is luxurious and very practical for our family (3 kids). My wife is in love with this car! Amazing interior with technology galour. My wife is glad she has this car as it has functioned well as a family hauler but as soon as the kids are dropped off she is driving in style and loves the way Acura has designed a vehicle with that in mind. We are the type of family that likes quality and luxury but reliability is important as well and we feel proud to add an Acura to our garage along with our Lexus!!! My wife used to try and steal my car any chance she had now I am the one grabbing her keys!!! Thank you Acura for making IMHO the 2007 Luxury SUV of the Year!!!!

reviews.title: Should be Acura's Flagship
reviews.review_text: I traded my fully loaded 04 MDX (Nav and DVD) for the 07 MDX 3 months ago and have driven +3k miles. The 07 MDX is a nice blend of the RL?s and MDX?s best features. Some believe not having a touch screen navigation is a down grade or worse than before. To me, this is absolutely not the case and more about people not understanding the system. Unlike center dash systems, the screen is on the top of the dash which greatly minimizes taking your eyes off the road. Of course, in this position it cannot be easily touched (so no touch screen). Once you get familiar with the control knob, it is quite easy to use. Upon learning the voice commands, just tell the system what to do?so why would it need to be touched? The stereo is awesome. I purchased the Tech and Sport model and believe there is a package upgrade (so I do not know about the base system). There is a PLII mode available for the XM radio which allows for 5.1 sound. The sound quality is absolutely amazing and I still find myself shaking my head and saying wow. All the functions on the radio are voice activated. If you want to change the station, just tell it. Want to listen to the channel 71 (jazz), just say ?XM 71?. Other advantages over the 2004 MDX included a 120 VAC power outlet, auto closing the rear door (no blown out ear drums from closing), and the blue tooth system. Some have complained about there not being a luggage rack but frankly in my 3 years with my 04 MDX I never used it. The luggage rack causes wind noise and reduces fuel efficiency so why make it a standard option. If you use the rack, install it as an option just like a towing hitch. The best part of the 2007 is the handling. Going around corners is a blast. I read some people complaining about the ride (not soft enough) and I thought my goodness they are nuts. Awesome ride, nothing that I test was better. Now, I do not know why Acura didn?t install the auto rearview mirror. But honestly with the rear tinted windows, I have never had to change the mirror when cars were behind me so I do not miss this feature. Here?s my final thought. My brother owns a Toyota Sequoia, my buddies drive a BMW X-5, Lexus 330 and Chevy Tahoe, and my sister drives a ML Mercedes (always in the shop) and whenever we go anywhere who?s rig does everyone want to take...the MDX.

reviews.title: top of the class
reviews.review_text: I was a little leary to buy the new mdx. I have owned Lexus gx470 a Yukon denali. I did not thing it was going to be big enought or nice enought. I drove it and thought wow. This is one killer suv. It drives like a sports car and it is fun to drive. I got the loaded sport, with everything on it and it was still cheaper than lexus, with only base option. I also like that the second and third row seats fold flat, which is great. The interior in the sport is very nice. I am very glad to have bought this Mdx. The optons are great XM, Easy Nav which you can use going down the road, which lexus you can't. I have know complaints yet, but it has only been two months.

reviews.title: First Impressions of the 2007 MDX
reviews.review_text: I currently own a 2002 MDX (with touring and NAV)and recently brought it in for routine maintenance. The dealership kindly loaned me a 2007 MDX for the day. I have been looking forward to my next MDX as I am completely in love with my 2002 which has met and surpassed all of my expectations. I had really been looking forward to the evaluating the new 2007 MDX. However, at day's end I felt really disappointed. What I liked: Intrumentaton was more modern. Higher rated towing capacity. Handling was improved. What I didn't: Cheaper feeling controls. Lower gas mileage (wrong direction!) The NAV system was an utter disappointment. Touch-screen is SO MUCH easier to work with and they did away with it. To make matters worse, the new screen is not as sharp or as bright as the old one. I tried adjusting it and was able to improve it slightly but still fiound myself disappointed. The one redeeming characteristic of the NAV system was a more accurate depiction of intersections than I have been accustomed to in my 2002 and also integration with traffic reporting. One other redeeming feature would be voice recognition, but it is my understanding that this is only available in some models. Note to ACURA: Go back to touch-screen NAV, make significant quality improvements, or both! I found the engine noisier and the ride rougher. I was surprised to find that my lower HP 2002 seems to accelerate better. I don't like the steering wheel which feels alot cheaper. The embedded controls are more difficult to work with. The sound system is not any better than the one in my 2002. The price is higher. The fuel mileage is lower. Features that were formerly standard are now high priced options (particularly the roof rack). I find myself wishing I had bought a 2006 before they made all these changes. While the 2007 is still a good vehicle with some improvements, overall this model is a disappointment. I'll probably wait to see what comes out in 2008. Don't get me wrong, this is a good vehicle. But they made the mistake of eliminating some of the competitive strengths. I have been spoiled by my 2002 which perhaps hightened my expectations of what I would find in the 2007 overhaul.

reviews.title: Acura uses slight of hand to drive up the cost.
reviews.review_text: The 2007 Acura MDX is a great vehicle. However, don't expect to see the same standard features on the base unit with tech features. I was disappointed to learn that the 2007 MDX with tech package did not come with a rain sensing wind shield, roof rack, nor an automatic rear view mirror. These items were standard on the 2004-06 MDX Touring model. With the 2007 they are now listed as options. Granted the 2007 MDX Tech package comes with navigaiton, sattelite radio (90-days included with purchase) and a few other bells and wistles but everything else is optional. I also noticed that the floor mats are not quite up to the previous standards included in earlier models. Once again for an additional price you can purchase "all weather" floor mats. If this type of pricing and equiping becomes an Acura trend, this will be my last Acura until corporate gets it right (for the consumer).

reviews.title: Truly a drivers SUV
reviews.review_text: The 300hp engine is alert and handling is flawless. The redesigned body grows on you even if your not blown away at first glance. The layout of instruments is well thought out. One thing I found refreshing is the standard features. This is a well equiped vehicle. However, some options, like the rear view mirror dimmer should be standard. For 40k, I believe it to be a very good value in a class of SUV's including the Volvo xc 90, Lexus 330, and even the BMW X5. Summary. If you test drive this vehicle, you may be quickly forgetting other SUV's you test drove before this one.

reviews.title: Best car
reviews.review_text: I love this car very much. I have bought the MDX with Tech and Entertainment package... I dont' need sport. I feel that everyone should buy this car! It is the best car ever!

reviews.title: Pretty amazing, those Japanese
reviews.review_text: Have been driving my wife's new 2007 MDX with sport,nav,ent and whatever other package was avalable. The stability is great when set on "comfort" but is way awesome when on the default "sport "mode.This thing on "sport "carves like a German sports sedan.The ride is excellent regardless,and the cabin is quiet.The optional sound system is among the best I have ever heard. I do suggest the sport package but will admit to not driving a base model yet. Fit,finish,ergonomics,styling are first rate. Predicted reliability should be great. This is our third MDX and we have NEVER had a mechanical problem. Our last one was badly crashed. Vehicle had major damage .All airbags deployed. My wife emerged with only one bruise in her arm ,a tribute to the safety or last years model. Improvements have been made to this one. I am happy to know that my wife and my 5 year old son are riding in a very safe vehicle. The suspension should help in accident avoidance. Compared to the european SUV's it is a geat value. The engine is great and has a healthy exaust note that is gratifying but not overly intrusive. It is not a V8 and it is a big heavy vehicle. 2 lane road close passes are best done on manual mode at high revs (but shift before that rev limiter kicks in). 4th gear is rather tall. A 6 th gear would do wonders to narrow the gaps. Sports mode should increase rpm's shift points to maximize power without needing a larger more expensive engine. Other vehicles such as my Audi A4 have that characteristic,and make the daily commute more exciting(but is to be used sparingly to get better fuel economy). My wife and 90% of the poplation will say it is more than adequately powered and no additional gearing or transmission characteristic options are desired. I can't imagine a better SUV at any price point, and especially at it's current price point. The fact that next year Honda will unveil a similar Pilot for thousands less makes me feel some concern for the viability of our our US auto industry.

reviews.title: I regret buying this car.
reviews.review_text: I bought 2007 MDX mainly for its third row seat. Now I regret it. I have owned the car for only 6 weeks, and I have experienced the following problems. My MDX has never been rattle-free. The right front door started to rattle the next day after the car was delivered. After the door was fixed, the sunroof and the front passenger seat started to rattle. After these were fixed, the dashboard started to rattle. After 4 trips back to the dealer in 6 weeks, I don?t want to go back again. I am totally disappointed. There are other problems besides the rattles. The AC compressor makes a loud thump when it starts, and it can repeat the start-and-stop cycle several times when you wait for the green light. The thumps are very annoying. The transmission makes knocking noises when both speed and rpm are low as if it were a 10,000-mile-old transmission. The back of the car produces a click sound when any of the doors is shut closed. The last 2 problems were considered ?normal? by the dealer. I didn?t believe so until I got a loaner 2007 MDX which had the same problems. I guess the transmission knocking sound and the clicking sound from the back are commonly seen in MDXs. The following is my opinions about the various aspects of the car. The exterior looks good, but it looks very much like the CR-V. The car is fast and steady although a bit slow from the light. Fuel economy is also good considering the sizes of the car and the engine. I get an average of 19.4 miles per gallon for half city and half highway driving. Noises from the tires are loud. The steering wheel should be redesigned because the bottom part is hard to grab and the control buttons on the bottom part are awkward to reach. The audio system needs a stronger base. The real-time traffic often doesn?t tell you which way and which lanes are affected by the accident. Some street names in New Jersey couldn?t be found in the navigation system. A park listed in the navigation system didn't exist. Here is a tip for finding streets. If you want to find street names like ?South Cleveland?, search for ?Cleveland?. Voice command works fine, but it never worked when I tried to call somebody. The tire pressure monitor system displayed ?tire pressure okay? even when the pressure was 4 psi below recommendation. I am not sure if my car came with a low tire pressure because I just figured out how to get the readings yesterday.

reviews.title: Best in class
reviews.review_text: I also test drove the BMW M5, the Porsche, the Volvo, the Saub, and the Audi. For the money, the Acura MDX is the best--hands down. The ride and e-comforts are excellent. See for yourself.

reviews.title: My Wife Was Right
reviews.review_text: Our family of five had out grown our Accord and so we began our search for a vehicle to replace it. I drive a Tahoe, which provides plenty of room, so I suggested lets get another SUV and my wife gleefully agreed. However, she then went on to express her disdain for driving an SUV as big as the Tahoe. So still needing a vehicle bigger then a car but not as big as a Tahoe we happily agreed on, what I like to refer to as, a Jr. SUV. With my conviction on a GM product and the fact that the Cadillac Jr SUV received great reviews I thought it was a shoe in. My wife though, being a big Honda fan, had other plans. So we ventured onto the Honda dealer and we both agreed that the Pilot is a no go and no way are we driving a minivan. She then said "Hey Acura is made by Honda. Let's take a look at them" I of course resisted but she was big on the 07 MDX. It looked a lot better then the Pilot and offered quite a bit more so we began to compare. We looked at several others such as the Volvo and Saab but none compared. I never thought I would say this and I know that my wife isn't going to be reading this so it' ok to admit but this is the best vehicle purchase I have ever been a part of. We have had it for almost a month and yes I do make up excuses in order to drive it. I still enjoy my Tahoe but driving the 07 MDX is absolute LUXURY in an SUV. Oh yeah, and don't listen to the sales reps. You can tell a big difference between comfort and sport suspension. Which by the way are both great. I like the sport and she prefers comfort. Two thumbs up babe you were right. You sure make a good-looking car look even better.

reviews.title: WOW, What an amazing SUV!
reviews.review_text: I test drove all the higher end mid sized SUV's.......Lexus, BMW, Volvo, Porsche, Infinity and Acura. I decided on the MDX as I was completely amazed at its ability to handle corners and the motor was responsive and smooth plus sounds really great. This is the wife's car, but gentlemen you'll want to take this rig for a spin every chance you get. I purchased the entertainment package and although the jury still out there on the high cost, the system is fantastic and high quality. The kids are completely quiet and I can listen to a ballgame via the XM radio without them complaining, "Dad do we have to listen to the game"? Guys, the stereo is quality (yes loud) and has lots of bass but the wife prevents me from cranking it up with the kids which is probably a good thing. I liked the Navigation system screen up high rather than in the middle of the dash because it is easer to see while driving and the backup camera display works well while coordinating looking at the mirrors. The voice activation system works great. It allows changing interior temperature (either passenger or driver) by just asking it too. The Navigation system can be changed by the voice commands as well. Making phone calls via the Bluetooth interface system is an absolute must for drivers who phone and drive. Ladies, just leave your phone in your purse as this car tells you whose calling and will answer or make calls for you. My only minor complaint is the instrument dash is a little dramatic with the round cylinders sticking out a little and the steering wheel although functional lacks the styling that it should. The triangular silver piece surrounding the center section gives the appearance of being cheap. At this price, the auto rear view mirror should not be an option and should be included as standard. I love the rest of the interior and find it completely awesome. One of my main objections over some of the other vehicles is they lacked a third row seat. Why have a SUV that only seats 5...go buy a AWD car instead. Let's face it, the back seats in all the mid size SUV's are best suited for the kids/teens and this third row (especially with a movie on) has the kids fighting who gets to get in the back. In my experience, this rig is the best SUV on the market. Hope this information helps you. Best regards and God Bless!

reviews.title: Most space a a Acura Ever.
reviews.review_text: I have 4 big kids and befor in my other SUV they were not confertuble sitting in it but now they are.

reviews.title: So woth the money
reviews.review_text: I payed alot over my range and at the end it was all worth it. I have never had a better car. The tegnoligy is amazing and the car is confertibull.

reviews.title: Best car i have ever had!!!!!!!!
reviews.review_text: If you do not get this car you are crazy. It was worth all the money we paid for it.I like the new everything to it.

reviews.title: Very Satisfied
reviews.review_text: I have purchased cars from these guys over the years with great results. I recently purchased a 2006 Acura MDX with 193,000 miles. The miles scared me a little bit but the one owner car has all of the service records from the Acura dealership and runs great. My last car was a BMW X5 and that thing was a money pit! Constant repairs. This Acura has all of the features that the BMW had (heated leather seats, rear view camera, bluetooth, etc) with a 6 cylinder, 24 valve V Tech engine that is as fast as the BMW V8 engine at about half the cost of gasoline. Don't let the high miles scare you. These guys only purchase vehicles that meet their strict guidelines. They have been in the business for many decades and they know how to pick good cars. I waited 2 months before putting this review and I like the car even more than when I first purchased it. No problems at all. Keep up the good work guys. It's hard to find trustworthy dealers anymore.

reviews.title: I love this SUV but it's time to get something new
reviews.review_text: This SUV has endless of room inside of it. Comes in handy if you need a second vehicle so the kids don't destroy your baby.

reviews.title: I like and need its utility
reviews.review_text: I purchased my 2006 Acura MDX Touring in Salt Lake City, UT back in late December 2008 as an Acura Certified Pre-Owned vehicle. It had about 32,000 miles on it at the time. The battery died the following day, but the car dealer (Mike Hale Acura) replaced it for free, no questions asked. My only concern with the car then was the original owner never installed the optional Acura MDX towing package, including transmission cooler, yet installed an after-market tow hitch and was pulling a boat around with the vehicle. I've never used the tow hitch for anything except my bike rack and up to 5 bicycles. Now (May 2019) at 145,000+ miles, I've never had any transmission issues / problems. I have replaced all of my engine and transmission mounts, shocks, struts, engine battery (twice), power steering column, tires (twice), front brake pads, rear brake pads (twice), timing belt, platinum tipped spark plugs, etc., and I religiously follow Acura's recommended service schedule for driving in severe conditions. For the last 3-1/2 years I've been driving in the very hot and dusty Phoenix, AZ metro area. I really like this vehicle. I've found it to be safe, pretty reliable, and practical. It's been the best all-around car I've ever owned (out of 1974 Buick LeSabre, 1979 Honda Accord hatchback, 1986 Mitsubishi Starion ESI-R, 1992 Honda Accord EX sedan, 2000 Acura 3.2 TL, 2008 Toyota Camry XLE v6). A car is not an investment, it's a necessary liability. Like any car, if you don't neglect it, and you don't abuse it, it should treat you well. It's just that Toyotas and Hondas typically treat owners better over the long haul than any other car make, IMHO.

reviews.title: Good but not great....
reviews.review_text: We have put 80,000 miles on our MDX and, overall, it has been a good but not great vehicle. Driven day to day, and on long highway trips, the MDX performs very well. Engine & transmission performance, ride, handling, and NVH are all excellent. Fuel economy is consistent with the revised EPA ratings of 15 city/ 21 highway. And overall build quality is exscellent. That said, we have had the following problems: -- the brake rotors are clearly undersized and prone to warping. We have had to get them recut or replaced four times. -- the dash vents are flimsy, and three out of the four have broken over the years -- the AC system recently developed a leak and lost its refrigerant charge. Our local (excellent) mechanic could not locate the leak with either a leak detector or using the dye method. He recharged the system, it seemed to be working well, but lost its charge again after one month -- every few months since new, the stability control warning light comes on when the car has been parked overnight. Stopping the car, turning the engine off, and restarting corrects the problem. Nothing seems to be wrong with the system, and no diagnositc code is recorded.

reviews.title: Best SUV I've owned other than my Jeep Cherokee
reviews.review_text: Bought this SUV used from a private seller, got it for $2,800 Canadian. We flew down to pick it up and drove it 900 Kms back to where we live. My first impression of this 15 year old SUV was it was in pretty great shape. Body looked very good and the interior was beautiful. Only complaint is the Nav screen had a big black circle blob, but I could still read the time and and it didn't block any important information. Driving it back home was such a treat. This SUV has power and then some to pass and go up hills without a hiccup. Gas mileage was awesome for a V6. Filled it full twice for the 900km trip home. Very roomy and comfortable seats. We have owned this for a year now and we have probably replaced almost everything on it. Radiator, brakes, power steering lines, power steering O-ring, as it was whining and that was a cheap fix. Gaskets etc. We live in Northern BC Canada and the winters are long and harsh. So putting this SUV to the ultimate test up here was a experience. The gear shifter would get stiff and had to be lubricated twice so far, I'm sure we will need to replace the cable as lubing it sometimes helps. Minus all the fixing. Motor runs quiet and amazing with having 250 thousand Kms on it driving in winter ice and deep snow was challenging. Got used to how it handles pretty quick. We have dry snow and cold winters not wet and sloppy conditions. And it handled it fairly well. Excellent tires make a huge improvement with how it handles. Put on some Cooper's ATs and it handles great. No hydroplaning, and so far we have hit Nov. And just got some ice on our roads and it doesn't even slide. May still put on some studded winters but so far these Cooper tires are holding up nicely. It came with no block heater so we had to install one of those too. I'd have to say in really taking care of it we have put in close to 2k in parts to help maintain it, as previous owner never really seemed to replace or fix problems. I'd honestly recommend this SUV for new drivers and or people who live in varying conditions or who want a reliable SUV. If maintained properly and regularly. I was a bit caught off guard though with having to fill it with premium gas only!!! But I understand because of the type of motor it has and that too should never ever be compromised, don't fill it with regular gas as it can cause a whole lot of issues.

Only complaint is that if the navigation goes out, you also lose your temperature controls except for the most basic. Poor design on that particular item. At 13 years old, The perforated leather seats are drying out and starting to tear easily but the rest of the car looks new. I still enjoy driving it and I'm very reluctant to get rid of it.

reviews.title: Tough reliable Tank
reviews.review_text: Nice and roomy with a quiet quality interior, OK on gas for a heavy AWD. A number of interior, exterior and mechanical updates were made for 2004. The V6 engine added slightly more power and is now rated at 265 horsepower and 253 pound-feet of torque. Outside, you'll find a restyled front fascia, new chrome trim, dual exhaust tips, a new wheel design for Touring models, updated headlights and taillights and a rear wing spoiler. The interior now features trendy brushed metal-look trim for the center stack, leather armrests, auto-on/off headlights, new ambient foot lighting and enhanced functionality of the second-row seat for third-row access. Touring models get a new version of the Bose premium audio system and power lumbar support for the driver seat. Finally, safety has been improved on all MDXs with the addition of side curtain airbags and a tire-pressure monitoring system.

reviews.title: Outstanding vehicle

The overall mileage is about 17 mpg, but hey, it's a big luxury car. We did have a power steering leak but this is fixable by changing out the O rings. You can do this yourself or get it done at a garage for about $350. There's third row seating which has plenty of space for kids. Electronics are a little dated but the sound system is fine. We added satellite radio and a rearview camera.

reviews.title: 8 Years Old and Still Lovin' It
reviews.review_text: Our 03 MDX is the best car we've ever owned! With 90K on the vehicle, it is as tight, responsive and as good looking as the day we bought it. Like most vehicles, we have had a few very minor maintenance items. Seat trim broke, rear A/C stopped working (due to a relay that I was able to replace myself) and all of the tabs on the interior A/C vents are broken (common MDX issue) however the vehicle has been reliable, comfortable and does simply everything we have asked it to do. I believe I will easily be able to drive this care for another 100K. I pull a small trailer (PWC) and have loaded the vehicle with people and this car simply does everything we need. I don?t know much about the newer versions of the car however if you are in the market for an early 2000 SUV, I would highly consider looking at an 03 MDX.

reviews.title: SUV
reviews.review_text: All good except for transmission...on the third. All under warranty fortunately. Gas mileage is fair...17 in town and 23 hwy.

reviews.title: MDX is a great package
reviews.review_text: Love it so much we've bought a 2nd one (2008 Tech). It is a good size, "big enough" w/o being unwieldy and drives great, though the 2nd gen ones are really a revelation, handling like a 5,000lb version of my wife's BMW 3-Series. We've racked up 170K miles on this one w/o issue. Repairs have only been normal service items (change fluids, timing belt, etc.) except for one air conditioner repair. Though living in Arizona with 115 degree summers, running it 24/7 maybe contributed to that. Acura's Navigation is sourced from Alpine and is the best in the industry (says JD Powers). I used to work in the navigation software business so would have to concur with their assessment.

reviews.title: Great SUV except for Transmission problems
reviews.review_text: Bought my 2003 Acura MDX in 2008 with 88000 miles on it. Loved this vehicle. Took it everywhere. It now has 142000 (March 2010). The transmission went out at the 142000 miles and I was told that there was a chance that the transmission would not be able to be rebuilt. Waiting for word on how much it will cost me to fix. However everything else about this SUV was awesome! Great handling, loved the interior design, the room and comfort.

reviews.title: One of the best cars I have ever owned!
reviews.review_text: We have put 150K on this car and have only had one problem. We put a new starter in at about 65K. Other than that, this car has been great. Many complain about transmission problems with this car but I have not experienced this yet. It is a little cramped on long drives though. This is not unusual for Honda products though.

reviews.title: It saved our life...
reviews.user_name: Real Estate Broker and Excellence advocate
reviews.review_text: This is the fourth Acura we have owned and the second that has saved our life. When the car had a couple of thousand miles on it.. now has 115,000+ ... we were on cruise control on a road trip... freeway... So California... five lanes of traffic moving at about 75 miles per hour. I pointed out some new homes off to the side of the road to my wife and we both took our eyes off of the road. When I turned back... all five lanes of cars were stopped... about 250 feet in front of us. Luckily the other drivers to our right... we were in the fast lane... had been paying attention and were slowing down way behind us. I jammed my foot on the brake... could feel the pedal pulsing as the ABS did it's job. No slide... no tire noise... but we were not stopping in time. I made a panic 90 degree turn to right... under full breaking and deceleration... we turned... and at the side of the road... still under full breaking and deceleration... made a second 90 degree turn to the left and came to a stop on the right shoulder... just to the right of about the third car in. We could not believe how the vehicle stability worked. I can't imaging any other car I've ever owned stopping us safely. It was amazing... scary... in fact terrifying. It has never had any work done other than scheduled maintenance... looks... feels... drives... like new. This is a wonderful car.

reviews.title: Watch out for Transmission Problems
reviews.review_text: Purchased 2003 MDX new. Everything about vehicle is great except for transmission which failed at about 80K miles. After much pressure Honda agreed to pay half the $4,550 cost of a reconditioned transmission. Honda settled a class action suit for defective transmissions for model years up to 2002, but my model year was not covered. Clearly they are still having problems, so be sure to maintain vehicle according to warranty specs. As well the dealer advised to change transmission fluid at twice the frequency recommended in owners manual. Transmission has no filter so impurities will limit life in his view.

reviews.title: Great All-Around SUV
reviews.review_text: This is my first luxury SUV I've ever owned, and hopefully my last! I've owned a '94 Toyota Camry, a '95 Honda Accord, and a '93 Chevrolet Suburban, and extensively driven plenty of other vehicles. My MDX has 136,000 miles and gets 18mpg in the city and 23mpg on the interstate. For potential buyers, I'll list some of the pros and cons of this vehicle. Pros Steering & Handling: I live in a mountain region so the exceptionally tight steering and suspension are put to use on a regular basis. Also, Acura used a shorter, wider wheelbase for this vehicle which shortens the turning radius and makes the vehicle VERY easy to maneuver in the city. Interior: The leather, in spite of being 7 years old, has held up nicely. The local climate is very dry so I recently started using a leather conditioner. Some nice features are the third row seat, the ease at folding the seats up and down to take advantage of the massive cargo area, and the additional power outlets in the jockey box and rear cargo area. A very well thought-out interior. AWD: This system is managed by the car computer and sends most of the power to the front wheels. When slippage occurs, power is automatically transferred to the rear wheels. Snowy and icy roads are the norm here for 4 months out of the year and the system performs very well under these adverse conditions. Honorable mentions: Bose 9 speaker sound system, V-TEC engine, Sun Roof, Heated Seats (a must in cold climates) and all the other standard included features. Cons Ride: The downside of a tight suspension is that rough roads can make for a rough ride. Also I had to rebuild most of the front suspension at 120,000 miles. Noise: On smooth roads, the noise is negligible, unless there is wind. With rough roads and/or wind, be prepared to put in the earplugs! Hill Climbing All of the great features on this vehicle do add quite a bit of weight, and getting this car up a hill requires a LOT of gas. It will climb okay, but be prepared to sacrifice your gas mileage. That's pretty much it for the cons. On a scale of 1-10 I would give this vehicle an 8.5

reviews.title: Tranny problems
reviews.review_text: I shopped for a Toyota and ended up with the MDX. Although I loved the car for the biggest part up until now, I have to say that I am extremely disappointed to find that I need a new transmission at 100,000 miles. That would be expectable if this was a Ford, but I expected to see this car go at least 150,000 before I had to change the tranny. After reading up on the Acura "blogs", I now find out that Acura had increased the size of the engine, thereby cutting back on the size of the tranny. The '02 & '03 Acura's are apparently known for this problem. Unfortunately, Acura doesn't want to hear about the problem. I am now shopping for that Toyota I should have purchased 4 years ago.

reviews.title: 3rd Row is nice in luxury mid-size

The MDX is really nice, but an absolute gas hog. Just a little drive from the suburbs into the city and back again, you are looking at about 1/4 tank of gas. We are getting 14.9 city and 17.6 highway. With the price of gas these days, I recommend getting a luxury 4-door car, a smaller CRV-type, or gasp, a mini-van. It's not that this MDX isn't a beautiful car, but with the price of gas and the environmental concerns, I recommend buying something with a higher mpg.

reviews.title: Buy a Lexus
reviews.review_text: If you can get away with the smaller Lexus, do it. The quality diff is huge. From the day I bought my MDX, certified used with 50k, its poor overall quality has been apparent. Dont get me wrong, its not a Ford, but a luxury vehicle its not. A/C was the first to go out, 2 months after buying. Moisture runs in the window shaft during rain, snow, or after car wash and then gets the inside of the window wet if you roll the window down, which when in the winter when salt dries inside the window is pretty annoying. Trannie issues, rattling issues, and gas tank clunking. All of which Im told from dealer are "characteristic" of the MDX and there's nothing to be done. Im told these problems were fixed in later model years.

reviews.title: Just Solid
reviews.review_text: I bought my MDX with 108K on it. I have had it for 6 months now, and have 115K. This is just an all-around solid vehicle. It's as inoffensive as a vehicle can be. The ride is quite comfortable and yet it handles as well as a sporty car. There's barely any lean on turn, and it simply sticks to the road. The thing that really stands out to me is how well everything works. Well over 100K and the seats are still great, not too mushy. Everything works perfectly. Every button, every lever, everything you touch is solid. Even opening and closing the windows and moonroof is a joy. There is a wonderful solid thud with each window/door/lock and every power option is trust inspiring. Make no mistake, this is not a Bentley, or a Porsche, but it is about as good in every area as a car can be. One note: '01-'02 MDX/Pilot/Odyssey had a tranny problem from design. You can go to Acura's website and enter your vin, and it will tell you if the recall was taken care of. Most had a jet oil kit installed to get fluid to the 2nd gear which was burning out too soon. That being said, 95% of these vehicles have been fine. Most of the others had the trannys replaced under the extended warranty, or quite often Honda has split the cost to install a reman. Your absolute worst case scenario would be a tranny replacement at a cost of roughly $3000. But remember, most MDXs are perfectly fine, and that $3K is mostly already reflected in the resale value. You can pick up a good '01 for about $10K, which is significantly less than you would pay for anything else that would even come close to the quality of this vehicle. Also, it's my experience that Acura/Honda takes great pride in their reliability ratings, and will almost always offer some concession to ensure the owner is satisfied. Buy it, you'll love it.

reviews.title: "MDX" The standard barer of Midsize SUV's
reviews.review_text: This vehicle hits all the right notes on style, comfort and value, but with so much tech packed into this platform, its reliability is questioned. The 3rd Gen MDX has a long history of ZF transmission issues. They rarely fail completely, but they are known to shift poorly under certain circumstances. MDX owners just learn to live with it for the most part, but it's a noticeable shortcoming on an otherwise stellar drivetrain. The Hybrid version of this vehicle has a different transmission and frankly operates in a different manner than standard AWD SUV's. Having three electric motors assisting the drivetrain at various points illustrates how complex the Hybrid MDX's propulsion system can be. The system although powerful at 300 Hp is not seamless and linear in it's acceleration. The engine and electric motors combined are all applied in hard acceleration but there are distinct surges in the powerband that you can feel. Reminiscent of a transmission slip but not exactly. Acura must be aware of this glitch and issued a TSB that is supposed to address it. So with that said the MDX Hybrid is a really good SUV with some issues in it's complex drivetrain. The ultimate reliability will be determined as we surge and slip into the future.

reviews.title: Glad I found it
reviews.review_text: Wanted to make the change from myAudi A6 Quattro to an SUV, My wife has the Lexus 450h. After driving several models (mostly new) of SUVs, my research lead me to Acura and the 2017 MDX Sport Hybrid. I found only 5 in the entire nation and flew from CO to CA (Oakland Acura) to buy it. First off is Acura’s great CPO program. Next is the refined styling and features (I have the Advanced package). The hybrid engine is smooth and I get from 24-27 mpg in combined driving. The acceleration and shifting is very smooth (I think my wife likes my Acura better than her 450h as she is very complimentary of the vehicle when she get in). The adaptive cruise is OK but I find it a little awkward and I am OK not using for the few times I am on the open road. I find the engine shut off at stops to very responsive when I accelerate and I don’t even realize it is present (maybe that’s the benefit of the hybrid vs the non-hybrid model). The Sh-AWD works very well in the CO snow and I have no problems getting anywhere. Originally looked at other brands (Audi, BMW, Lexus) but glad I found Acura and the Sport Hybrid MDX. Would gladly buy again. One item of note is the Hybrid is NOT for towing! If you want to pull anything, might need something else.

reviews.title: Amazing piece of engineering
reviews.review_text: As a two time Lexus Hybrid owner, I was searching for a newer used Lexus RX450h hybrid. I came across this vehicle in my search, unaware that Acura even made an MDX in a hybrid variant. I decided to go test drive a new one locally at my Acura dealer. I was simply stunned at how Honda engineers had put this SUV package together from the NSX super car. It was amazing. I love the seemingly endless smooth power from the 3.0 V6 engine and dual clutch transmission. Having owned Lexus hybrid SUV’s they seem downright anemic compared to this car. It is definitely sporty and fun to drive this 4,500 pound SUV around town or up in the mountains. It handles much better than the Lexus on dirt and gravel roads with the super handling all wheel drive (independent electric motors at each rear wheel allow one wheel to have power while potentially braking the other in turns). I can’t wait to try it out in the snow. The best part of all of this is how the car seamlessly transitions from the gas engine to the three electric motors without even a shudder. The only indication you get is the tachometer drops to zero and the quiet ride. I handily beat the EPA estimates of 26/27 mpg and usually get 32 mpg in mixed highway and city driving, and have even attained 34 mpg on a tank. Expect about 30 mpg on a constant cruise at 75 mph. I have surpassed 500 miles on several tanks with over three gallons of gas remaining, so 600 miles is possible - take that Tesla! Your bladder will give out long before the car needs gas! All of this power and luxury with top notch safety features. I love the lane keep assist and lane departure warning paired with the radar cruise control. It’s like semi autonomous driving. I drove from St Louis to Denver by myself in about 12 1/2 hours and felt like I had an auto pilot guiding me the whole way. Simply amazing. I also like the surround view cameras and the Milano leather seats which are so comfortable. The ELS sound system is amazing, and once you get used to the two screens for NAV and the radio/climate control, you won’t even blink. Apple Play came out in 2018, and is the only thing I would like, but that a pretty minor thing compared to the great value this car offers in a used vehicle. I picked my up as a CPO car from an Acura dealer, with just 16,000 miles on it, and it feels like a new car to me. Finally, the cavernous three row seating and cargo area holds 91 cu ft of stuff. It beat the Lexus by about 15 cu ft, and is only 4 cu ft smaller than a Tahoe. That is what really sealed the deal for me. I needed extra space to be able to clean and service our VRBO rental, and this vehicle performs in every way. Do yourself a favor and test drive this car. I think you’ll be glad you did. I felt like we would never go off of Toyota/Lexus again after having owned three Lexus and three Toyota’s, but I have to say, the Honda engineers really outdid themselves with this one.

reviews.title: Unreal, simply unreal
reviews.review_text: This car is jaw dropping in person (judging by the camera phones, thumbs ups, smiles, and attractive women's reactions, I'm not alone in thinking so). The NSX has the most streetable power, torque, and driving characteristics of any competitor outside a 911 Turbo S, but doesn't look like every other boring Porsche. Stoplight to stoplight it is a bolt of lightning with the hybrid motors providing instant torque and removing turbo lag! Plus, you can fit a set of golf clubs in the trunk which can't be said for ANY other supercar! I drove mine 2,300+ miles in 3 days and at 6'4" tall I was still comfortable. The varied driving modes are really nice. The car has a distinct personality in each mode, though I don't use Sport ever really. Unlike some cars it is not always "on" so you can drive it and chill or flip it into Track mode and summon demons from its soul. I really wouldn't change anything except maybe making the trunk better insulated from exhaust heat. The Infotainment system is fine as it accepts Car Play and Android Auto. There is a volume knob on the wheel that I use so I can't complain about the slider (which is a dumb complaint in my opinion). The exhaust sounds nice in Sports Plus and Track but is not an obnoxiously loud as some. Then again, this isn't a car you buy to draw attention to you by being neon colored and obnoxiously loud. Real engine sounds are piped into the cabin and you can easily take a business call if you put it in Quiet mode. Overall, I could not be happier with the car. Much is made about the interior, but I think Alcantara, carbon fiber, and leather are nice and it will age well unlike the tacky interiors of some. If you're considering buying one, do yourself one favor. Find one they rent at a track rental company like the one in Vegas and give it a go around the track in Track mode. Track mode (which I use on the street 90% of the time) is where the supercar character really shines. Don't bother with Sport as it is underwhelming and the worst of Quiet and Sport Plus modes in my opinion. Oh and the NSX can be seen beating Aventadors, GTRs including the Nismo, Teslas, Huracans, 488s, AMG GTs, and more in real life drag races on YouTube if you doubt its quickness! She is a keeper boys!

I was very impressed by the overall fit and finish and the simplicity of setting the four driving modes. With the dynamic mode set to track the car is seriously fast. The ride is the most impressive part. With the dynamic mode set to sport the car rides better than most if not all other sports cars. I would not hesitate drive this car across country. There is no storage space anywhere in the main cabin other than a place to put down your phone. There is a cupholder attachment stored in the clove box for two cups but it restricts the passenger's space and comfort. The Acuralink is primitive by todays standards set by every other high end manufacturer. Comparing the Acuralink app to the one in our TESLA and the I8 we traded for this car it is several years behind. This is a big surprise as the Hybrid system is seamless and the start stop function is less obnoxious than most cars using a stop start system to save gas. reviews.title: Great car for what it is.
reviews.review_text: Let's start with what it isn't: - It isn't a supercar. At least by the standards of today. 290 hp was pretty good back in 2001, but now is less than a current Nissan 370Z, or a Porsche Cayman S, or a BMW Z4. And it's WAY below a Corvette or a 911 or a Ferrari. So if you have to have the fastest car around, don't buy an NSX. - It isn't an investment-type car. While they hold their value pretty well, I don't see them ever appreciating like a classic Ferrari. - They aren't cheap to repair. They are VERY reliable, but when things need fixing, and eventually something will need fixing (especially with an older NSX) the parts and labor aren't cheap. Now let's talk about what it IS: - It's one of the best looking cars out there. Period. It's an elegant and timeless design that will still be just as gorgeous 20 years from now. - It's a wonderful compromise for a sports car. Enough HP to go 0-60 in 5 sec. (That's fast enough for me) yet I can easily get 18 mpg or better in city (Chicago) driving. Try getting that kind of mileage in a Ferrari! It's comfortable enough for a long trip, yet feels perfectly at home on a race track (which I've done). It's exhilarating to drive, yet easy to drive (it's 6-speed is as easy and slick as my old Miata). If you want to putter around town it will drive and act like any Acura, but when you want a thrill, take it up to it's 8000 rpm redline - the sound is AMAZING! To summerize, the best description I can give for this car is it's very Porsche 911-like with exotic looks and the reliablility of an Acura. If that idea appeals to you then by all means buy one. You won't regret it.

reviews.title: Best Iconic 90s supercar
reviews.review_text: This is a great comfortable driver that turns heads everywhere I go. It's a dream car for most 90s kids who are adults now and recognize it as soon as they see it.Handles like a dream and gives the driver the manual interactions they need to feel like a racer driver .

reviews.title: Superb Handling!
reviews.review_text: I've owned 2 NSX's: a 1991 and a 2000 NSX-T. The boost in HP between the 1991 and 2000 model is noticable. Little has changed about the styling other than the color-matched tops for the '95+ models and of course, the T-top. The 2000 model has power-assist steering at lower speeds which adds to its comfort-factor. Though comfortable for long rides, I was always less than impressed with the interior styling. It seemed like a car with its high price tag and such brilliant exterior styling would have a striking interior to match. Regardless, the balance and handling of the NSX makes you feel like you're riding on rails and more than makes up for any lack in interior styling. My positive experience with the performance of my 2000 NSX-T could only be overshadowed by its reliability.

reviews.title: Great Styling
reviews.review_text: I purchased a 2021 Acura RDX Technology SH-AWD CPO with 2800 miles. Initially I was interested in a 2019(new design), but had difficulty finding one in the color of our choice. My wife and I enjoy this vehicle for its appearance/styling, handling, low cabin noise and performance. We test drove a '19 Mazda CX-5 turbo, '18 BWW X1, '18 Audi Q5, '21 Audi Q3, and a '19 Lexus NX300. We felt the RDX had the best ride and most quiet engine especially under heavy acceleration. The Q5 was close, but preferred the more modern interior cabin design of the Acura. I have watched numerous car review videos of the RDX and the two most common complaints were of the touch pad system and the apparent difficulty of the transmission hunting to find the appropriate gear. We have found that both of these have not been an issue. After about a week of driving we mastered the touch pad and the transmission shifts seamlessly while in comfort mode in city driving. Thus far this has been an excellent vehicle after driving approximately 1000 miles. I look forward to driving this vehicle(wife is main driver) and I drive a '16 BMW 340i with manual transmission. It is interesting how one can become biased watching or reading reviews without even having driven the vehicle-need to drive and test all of them. I like the fact that the RDX was designed and built in the US.

reviews.title: Decent car for the money you pay
reviews.review_text: After driving Land Rover Discovery Sport HSE for 3 years, I did not like RAV4 and CRV when I did test drive. I liked Mercedes GLC and Audi Q5 but those are a bit expensive. I don't like BMW X3 and Lexus NX looks. I started looking for something that's fun to drive but not too pricey either. I liked RDX 2020 when I drove it and it's cheaper than GLC and Q5. So I ended up buying 2020 RDX SH-AWD A-Spec. Based on 3 weeks of ownership Pros: Performance (sports mode is pretty good and it handles curve nicely), Styling (good exterior design although A-Spec should offer more), Comfort, Panoramic Sunroof, Decent Interior (it's not the best but RDX is cheaper than most of the competitors), Android Auto (my last car didn't have it), 10.2" Center Display (personally I don't like in dash display). Cons: Fuel Economy (15 mpg, mostly city driving of 200 miles), Styling (I wish A-Spec would come with black side mirrors, black roof and black emblems/badges), No auto fold side mirrors, Blind Spot assist is not on the side mirrors. It's early for me to comment on reliability. Given the price compared to other competitors, RDX is fun to drive, good looking and comfortable. So far I'm happy with my decision to buy my first Acura.

reviews.title: Not exactly what I expected
reviews.review_text: I previously owned a Lexus RX 350, but all the dealerships are over an hour away, so I decided to try the Acura. I've waited 6 months to do this review because I think you need to spend some time in a vehicle before you rate it. It has taken me some time to get used to the features on this car, and the item I hate the most is the fact that unless you push the button, the car turns off at every stop sign, stop light, etc., so you can't just crawl forward in line. The other most disappointing factor is the seat comfort. After an hour on the road, it starts to feel like you're sitting on a rock. I picked one of the gray shades, and since it's the most popular car color right now, I have trouble finding my gray car among all the others in the parking lot. The exterior styling is so similar to so many other cars that it's hard to locate mine. The engine noise is much louder than my Lexus, and Acura recommends that you use premium fuel in a 4 cylinder engine. For the price, I wish I would have shopped around more.

reviews.title: Excellent Value With Great Horsepower
reviews.review_text: My current lease was coming to an end so I was looking to go from a sedan to an SUV. I was looking into purchasing a Hyundai Santa Fe and test drove it before any other vehicle. While the car was impressive, providing excellent features and good value for the price, I wasn’t too impressed with the ride itself, particularly the horsepower. The deal involving the Sante Fe fell through so I kept on with my search. Having done extensive research on all SUV segments and SUV’s within my price range I decided to look into the RDX. I test drove the vehicle and really fell in love with it. I was never the biggest Acura fan but they have knocked it out of the park with this SUV. The interior is luxurious with premium quality. The infotainment system needs a little getting use to but once all is figured out it is second nature afterwards. The SH-AWD technology Acura provides with their vehicles brings the fun factor to another level. It has the best handling of any vehicle I have ever owned or leased. Exterior has a cool look to it with chrome along the doors and front bumper. The RDX is comfortable with plenty of leg room space in the front and back seats. The price of the vehicle with the features you get is definitely a bargain in this luxury SUV segment. Many companies like Mercedes, Audi, BMW and others overcharge for various trim levels by adding just a few features to each trim. While shopping various SUV’s segments including economy and luxury many vehicles carried little to no horsepower, so for me that became a deal breaker. I wanted something that I can drive every day and have occasional fun with. As for trim levels, I ended up with the tech package AWD. I would say the A-SPEC trim is the sweet spot but it does not come with a spare tire. That is something that may be able to get negotiated into the deal. My Fiancée purchased a 2020 Lexus NX 300 recently and the RDX is by far the better vehicle and bargain all things considered. You can’t go wrong with the 2020 Acura RDX.

Brought it to the delearship and they advise that this was an issue on the 2020 model. They've change the front and rear brakes. Everything was awsome until the next week when the brakes started squeeking again. It stops after a minute or so but still it's annoying. The stop engine at a red light never works. Delearship told me that the battery needs to be fully charge in order to work and many other factors may cause this technology to fail. I use the car everyday and in perfect weather conditions an still it doesnt work. White noise coming out of the speakers after the car has been stop for over half an hour. This may drain the battery. Last but not least, okay our roads here in Canada are not perferct but still this car is suppose to be a smoothe ride and I have notice some rattles from the dash and the hatchback which can become annoying. I turn up the music volume which is not great in order to block the rattles. Other than this it rides great. Not the best fuel effecienty but I guess this is not the reason you buy an rdx. Comfort and performance are great and the sound system is incredible. Overall if you don't mine the cons go for it. I've learn to live with it but pretty sure i'll be giving back this car after the lease and maybe before.
