reviews.title: Perfect Comfort, Features and Performance
reviews.review_text: This SUV is the perfect size for us. Very comfortable inside with lots of room. All the safety features you could hope for. The heated seats (front and rear) and the air condition seats are an added bonus. The features available, good looks inside and out, and the excellent build quality make this a great purchase. The price was more than fair considering all you receive. The performance is excellent, considering it is only a 4 cylinder. The transmission shifts smoothly and picks the right gear almost all the time. The steering has more feedback and feel than my BMW 4 series. The brakes are solid and the ride is well controlled. I mostly like the safety features, and you can shut off some of the more aggressive ones. The only weakness is the entertainment system. It loads slow and lags, and the touch pad is too sensitive and difficult to use- very distracting while driving. But the ELS sound system with the Advanced Package is excellent.

reviews.review_text: The RDX has comfortable seats, with lumbar controls. Turning radius is amazing. The get up and go is awesome. Yes, you get what you pay for. After looking at several vehicles- I realized even if you pick out a pretty standard vehicle and add on some other packages/trims your going to end up paying what a luxury vehicle's price is anyway.

reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed with the 2020 RDX A-Spec
reviews.review_text: This is my 5th Acura vehicle purchase. I have owned 2 RDX (2016 & 2017)prior to my recent purchase of a 2020 model. I like the vehicle but remain disappointed that the brakes squeak every time that you start the vehicle until it warm up. I have reported this issue to the dealership several times since making my purchase in October, 2019 but they don’t seem to know how to resolve it. I was shown a letter from Acura as reference that it’s expected but the notice did not include or state that this was an issue for the 2020 models. I would really like to find a solution. If unable to resolve the issue I am going to trade the vehicle and definitely will not purchase another Acura. This should not happen with a new vehicle.

reviews.title: The best car i've ever had.
reviews.review_text: The rdx was superb car i love the power the comfortness the styling and everything on the car. I feel safe everytime im driving my rdx

reviews.title: Smooth ride
reviews.review_text: This car is exactly what I wanted. After owning a Benz C class for 14 years, I decided to purchase this vehicle because of it’s style and accessories.

reviews.title: Second trip to dealer for rattles.
reviews.review_text: I think rattles at 5000 miles suggest problems with build quality. I miss having a digital speed display and remote start. Even though remote start is available it cost $100 per year.

reviews.title: Great SUV
reviews.review_text: This SUV with technology has met all of my needs. It has plenty of leg room and in the cargo area. I love all the features!

reviews.title: Meets my needs.
reviews.review_text: So far this vehicle meets all of my expectations and more. It's comfortable, the right size and has great technology. Acura makes a great car.

reviews.title: Really great love my RDX
reviews.review_text: All options on the advanced I wanted except wireless charging, so added that for 10.00 from amazon and I am happy! Only 1000 miles so far but impressed, I traded 2011 Audi Q5 and think I did the right thing for me by switching. I like a sporty car that handles and accelerates and the RDX definitely satisfies me. Really surprised at the turning radius, almost able to square turns with this ShAWD.

reviews.title: Chose over MB GLC
reviews.review_text: After multiple test drives in Mercedes GLCs and Acura RDX, bought the RDX. Much better value for the money if you’re not hung up on the badge. BTW, I owned a Mercedes for past 10 years. RDX Advanced package loaded with many features that would cost several thousands $$ more on GLC.

reviews.title: Nice luxury small SUV
reviews.review_text: The car is great all around. Has a lot of great features and some kick in performance mode. It looks good. The Infotainment system is a little difficult to use. Great safety features (blind spot detection, lane departure, collision monitoring, etc.)

reviews.title: An average crossover.
reviews.review_text: I drove it with a lot of expectation after seeing many test drive videos. I felt the suspension is not soft even with comfort mode (I did feel minor road imperfections). The breaking is below average, especially on emergency braking situations. overall seating and riding positions are great. Road visibility is good. I'm absolutely loving the exterior and interior design. There are some cheap plastic feeling on the dash ( Auto climate display is a bit cheap look like 90's HiFi stereo display) and storage options are excellent. I would expect more riding comfort from a vehicle which is touching 50K.

reviews.title: First Acura in 25 years
reviews.review_text: This vehicle replaces a German SUV that was beginning to show signs of costly repairs. Having driven the European cars for 2.5 decades, I decided to look for something Japanese to enjoy a bit of reliability and ease-of-ownership compared to the others. I look forward to many trouble-free miles of ownership with this vehicle.

reviews.title: Great car for the looks and value.
reviews.review_text: What can I say. I traded my Lexus for the RDX. It was a great option and value. Both are great car companies but Acura leads in technology and engineering.

reviews.title: Very reliable car.
reviews.review_text: The car meets alot of my needs reliability, sporty appearance and having a luxury feel. I drives and handles smoothly. I will recommend anyone to purchase this car.

reviews.title: Very Nice Car
reviews.review_text: I just purchased this car. Am still learning about it but it seems to have so many safety features that are making it worth the purchase. Am anxious to learn what all it can do!

reviews.title: Brakes Squeak On Brand New RDX
reviews.review_text: Purchased my new RDX less than a month ago and have had consistent issues with the brakes squeaking. Acura Service has attempted a few fixes without much success. Evidently this is a known problem that also occurs in older versions of the RDX and Acura has still not come up with a fix for the problem.

reviews.title: Fun to drive
reviews.review_text: I test drove lots of SUVs before I came back to the RDX. It was the only one to meet my expectations of looks, comfort, safety and fun to drive. Its too early to say it is reliable.

reviews.title: Plenty of power, decent fuel economy.
reviews.review_text: I looked at many midsize s u v"s before choosing this one, The reason I bought the Acura a spec was appearance, power, reliability, and resale value. Many of the competitors (Audi, Mercedes, Volvo) depreciate greatly when they get close to warranty expiring because the cost of maintenance. Some things that this vehicle is lacking is folding mirrors, more of a usable navigation system (it's ok with a phone connected) With the a spec package you don't get a spare tire just a flat fix kit that will only work for small holes in the tire so for a larger puncture you wait for a tow truck. another issue for me is you have to pay for oil changes in comparison Volvo gives you three years free services as others also do this for free. Another issue is if you have a warranty issue Acura might not give you a loaner car where as 90 % of the competitors will, the good news is this is a very reliable vehicle. In summery do your home work if your trading in your vehicle know the trade in value (use Kelly blue book) not the dealers on line valuator) if they bring up reconditioning fees the trade in should be considered in excellent condition .

reviews.title: Love this vehicle so far
reviews.review_text: Love the sportiness of this new RDX. It is zippy, handles really well and is easy to drive. Love the interior finishes and the overall look of the vehicle. Love, love, love the heated steering wheel!

reviews.title: Not for Snow
reviews.review_text: If you live in an area that gets snow, do not buy this vehicle. All the sensors are behind the big Acura logo on the front of the RDX. When it gets snow on it, all the driving systems shut down - Cruise control, lane keep assist and most importantly VSA - Traction control. After talking to Honda/Acura, this is how the RDX is designed! Simply, it handles horribly in the snow and on slushy roads. If you don't believe me, ask before you buy.

reviews.title: Big disappointment
reviews.review_text: I have a number of disappointments. Let's start with the automatic wiper blades that run off sensors. They start wiping when I don't need it and don't wipe when snow and rain accumulates. I am using bluetooth to play music from my phone and it constantly cuts out. My biggest complaint is the heating system. I live in Canada and we are experiencing some very cold weather and the vehicle runs cold for a long time and subsequently does not generate a lot of heat. The dealership says everything is working to specification. However I disagree. I'm in discussions with Honda Canada now to see if they can determine what the problem is.

reviews.title: Badass Vehicle
reviews.review_text: Awesome and xxxx good looking and very sporty even for this old man. Very happy with my decision on this vehicle. I recommend the RDX.

reviews.title: Best car ever in 45 years
reviews.review_text: Fast perfect handling excellent first class perfect car drives like your on air and flys perfect tech is fantastic every thing works unbelievable I can’t believe how fantastic this car is

reviews.title: Most fun SUV I've had to drive
reviews.review_text: I love this SUV and all of the safety features and interactive navigation screen. Large sunroof a bonus. The only thing I don't like is that it shuts off at stoplights. I can override that, but as far as I can tell I have to override everytime I start the car

reviews.title: Most comfortable and reliable car I own
reviews.review_text: This car has everything I was looking for. Luxury, comfort, style and performance. The all wheel drive and technology package is definitely the way to go. Still trying to learn everything on the infotainment center. Not as bad as I had read from others.

reviews.title: My wife and I love this car
reviews.review_text: This car fits all of our expectations. Not too big not too small. And not too expensive for a little of luxury. Very beautiful interior amenities. It's not too showy where your neighbors are jealous and not too much to grab the "wrong" attention. We're working folks living in a regular neighborhood. We love this car!

reviews.title: My dream car
reviews.review_text: I researched cars for over a year before deciding on the RDX with Advance package. My previous car, an Acura TL proved so reliable that I drove it for 15 years, over 200,000 miles with very minimal repairs. I have now donated the car to an organization that will benefit veterans and first responders and still give someone years of reliable transportation. The RDX I purchased is a driver's dream. I particularly love driver assists such as the heads up display and 360 degree cameras. As an older driver (70) I appreciate all of the safety features that will keep me (and other drivers on the road) safer by extending my vision and reactions. This is a car I'm very proud to drive down the road - it really turns heads!

reviews.title: Rock star sporty
reviews.review_text: Love the vehicle, it’s sporty design is what I was looking for, great sound system. It rides a little rough but other than that it fits my lifestyle perfectly.

reviews.title: Love this car
reviews.review_text: I have issues with my back, so I find the car very easy to get in and out of and the lumbar is the best I’ve ever had in a car. It’s very comfortable and roomy. Rims like a dream. My favorite Acura so far.

reviews.title: Acura RDX most reliable car I found after owning L
reviews.review_text: Very good car with luxury at right price. Luxury car with low gas cost per year and maintenance. Beautiful exterior and functional interior. Enough leg room front and back with large trunk.

reviews.title: New RDX 2020
reviews.review_text: I just got my new car a few days ago, so still in love with the newness! I am certain that I will be happy for the next few years.

reviews.title: Fantastic vehicle ,love it !
reviews.review_text: This vehicle is awesome !! Best vehicle I’ve owned so far . Interior and exterior is top notch ,Acura RDX is fun and comfortable. The power is amazing

reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed in the Acura RDX
reviews.review_text: This car is a very smooth ride, comfortably sized for me (a 5’1” 118 pound female), and very stylish too. I traded in a 2008 Mercedes sedan for this car and couldn’t be more happy. It has all the pep and zip I was used to with more space and new technology.

reviews.title: 2020 RDX Aspec. Not sure what's going on with it🤔
reviews.review_text: Im a MDX person already own two. Decided to switch 4 month ago to the new 2020 Aspec. Few concerns When I shut the engine the radio continues to play even after I open & close the driver's door. I had to start the process again. Start up shut dwn. Also it safety option is alarming/ amazing 🤷🏿‍♀️. it stops in the middle of the road because I made an improper lane change 🤣. Never doing that again ever. I tried reversing without my seatbelts it just stops. 😳 I'm hoping it's not a malfunction. I'm thinking this must be an extremely safe car My 2017 MDX never did that! Overall it's a keeper. My daughter love her 2019 ILS Aspec that she park her older model TSX for😊 She just wish the interior was like my RDX.

reviews.title: Great car as long as you don't use infotainment
reviews.review_text: This is an exceptional car which looks and drives like a dream. You will love it as long as you don't use any of the following... GPS AM/FM SiriusXM Music on USB Apple CarPlay/Android Auto Connected Phone The infotainment is a complete mess with daily glitches and freezes. These problems are widely reported and Acura doesn't seem to be able to fix them.

reviews.title: Great body style.
reviews.review_text: Love all the features. Styling is sporty and fun. Driving the RDX is effortless. All the interior controls are easy to use and easy to reach.

reviews.title: Great car. New owner.
reviews.review_text: Comfy and quiet ride. Brand new to us; we have only 500 miles on it so far. Nice color exterior; great brown interior. Very pleased.

reviews.title: First time leasing an acura
reviews.review_text: It’s nice it has a little rattle in the drivers side door that I’m hoping can be eradicated n didn’t come with a heated steering wheel

reviews.title: New to Acura, but love it!
reviews.review_text: Decided to go from Cadillac ATS to small SUV for increased safety. Did a lot research comparing the RDX to other brands and decided to choose Acura due to what you get for the money. The standard safety features would cost way more with similar vehicles. The infotainment system is intuitive and easy to use. My past cars have had a touchscreen and there are always fingerprints that you have to constantly clean off the screen, so I actually prefer this system. My only complaint is that you have to move up a package to get a heated steering wheel, but this is not a deal breaker.

reviews.title: Fun to drive, good performance.
reviews.review_text: We really like this car except for the interface for entertainment, phone etc. We replaced a 2016 Ford Edge which worked so much better on interfacing with it's Synch 3 system. Tried to buy another Edge but they couldn't find the model and color we wanted. Ended up with the RDX.

reviews.title: Fun vehicle to drive.
reviews.review_text: The RDX is smaller than what I thought I was going to purchase. I got the RDX A-Spec, White with Red Leather and big is it a good looking vehicle.

reviews.title: Fun to drive
reviews.review_text: Very comfortable ride. I feel secure in the vehicle with the safety features and tight handling. Stereo is awesome. Good power, particularly in Sport mode.

reviews.title: Acura 2020 RDX A-Spec SH-AWD
reviews.review_text: I bought the family’s first Acura in 2014. A 2010 TL-SH-AWD. Needless to say, I knew right away we would be a Acura family moving forward. Wife was finally ready for upgrade after driving her 02’ 4Runner since 2007. We went with the 2020 RDX A-Spec SH-AWD for a few reasons. First reason; Incredible styling, followed closely by safety and the affordable price point we achieved by leasing and owning a Acura already. Upgraded infotainment with Apple car play is perfect for us, safety features are must have for us as we have a 10 year old son. Overall we couldn’t be happier. Sport plus mode gives us all the power we need out of the 4 cylinder to zip around and pass when needed. Highly recommend the RDX to small family’s that need plenty of room for 5.

reviews.title: New car fever got me
reviews.review_text: This is a nice car but not the luxury I’m use to. Wanted to try a new model and now wish I would have stayed with Infinity’s. The car is nice but interior is standard with no sensors and after having sensors it’s so hard not to have them

reviews.title: Great Car
reviews.review_text: Previously owned a 2017 RDX so decided to try the 2020. Better in some ways but I miss the 6 cylinder engine and the old electronics were easier to use. New car is more comfortable and rides better. Looking forward to a long road trip to really get the feel of the car but, so far so good.

reviews.title: Great car!
reviews.review_text: I've owned the car for a few days so it's too early to write a review (i.e. reliability/performance). But so far I'm happy - it's a very comfortable car with great looks.

reviews.title: I Love This Car!
reviews.review_text: This care is very comfortable and has lots of safety features. My insurance payment actually went down as a result. I really like the Heads Up windshield projection and all the other safety features that keep your eyes on the road.

reviews.title: This model vehicle is a lemon as admitted by Acura
reviews.review_text: The infotainment system does not shut down when the car is turned off causing the battery to die. There is no fix. Acura service says "we do not know what to do" Acura corporate says they are working on it. Do not even think about getting an an Acura RDX. You will regret it if you do

reviews.title: Acura RDX: Run, don't walk from this car
reviews.review_text: I've leased a 2015, 2017, and now, the 2020. Worst of the three. Acura cheaped out on this year. Car rattles and shakes while driving. Backing out of my garage it shakes. The transmission is always hunting for the correct gear. The electronics is the WORST. The navigation system is a joke. Acura made it too complicated. Hard to key an address. The voice system takes too long and often won't find the location. EX: Was looking for street number 20178. Kept finding 2017A. Had to repeat three times. Last time shouting the number. They did away w/the CD Player, so had to load on a USB stick. More often than not the car won't find the USB stick. When it does, no easy way to play songs in a folder. VERY DISAPPOINTED and WON'T be leasing another RDX. Guess I'm stuck for three years w/this xxx.

reviews.title: Acura RDX is an excellent vehicle.
reviews.review_text: I never have to worry when I start my car because I know it will give me great performance every time. It’s a great car to own.

reviews.title: Love the new design.
reviews.review_text: Incredible array of features for the price. Amazing to drive. A comparable BMW or AUDI would cost $10,000 more. The stereo is phenomenal. I highly recommend this vehicle.

reviews.title: A great car for ALL purposes.
reviews.review_text: I have had 4 CRV's and an S2000 previously, I presently also own an Acura NSX-in addition to the NSX this a most enjoyable , and useful car to drive

reviews.title: Love the ride and comfort.
reviews.review_text: Having issues with the navagation. The screen goes blank. And voice commands takes time to process. Don't really like the touch pad. Somewhat confusing. It could take 5 to 30 minutes before nagavation screen works.

reviews.title: Not PERFECT!
reviews.review_text: I waited a long time to buy this car. My previous vehicle was an MDX, which I loved. I was very excited about the tech package on the 2020 RDX! Unfortunately, one week after I drove off the lot, I was back at the dealership. A complete reset of all the technology settings was necessary. I was told that this was a KNOWN issue. After researching myself, I learned this is a LONG-KNOWN issue. WHY WOULD ANYONE SELL A $40,000 VEHICLE WITHOUT DISCLOSING THIS PROBLEM???? I was also told that it may happen again??? Really??? This is NOT GOOD. I don’t know if this is an Apple Software problem, or an Acura issue, but it’s a problem that has definitely changed my feelings about my car and Acura’s ethics! I’m very sad and disappointed.

reviews.title: I so enjoy sitting high
reviews.review_text: I'm enjoying my cool, fancy SUV. This is what my Grand kids say. This SUV make me feel younger. I'm always trying to find somewhere to go,

reviews.title: The vehicle is living up to my expectations.
reviews.review_text: I am ejoying the experience of owning a new car as usually I buy three year old used car. The RDX is loaded with modern safety features and I truly feel comfortable driving the car.

reviews.title: Classy car with lots of extras for the money!
reviews.review_text: This car is a retirement car. I searched for many months to find what I wanted. Mark B. at Hendrick Acura help me settle on just the right thing. It is a black RDX with Advance Package. I LOVE IT!! Thanks to Mark and the Hendrick Acura team for helping a dream come true. I am a loyal customer now!

reviews.title: Meets and Exceeds all expectations
reviews.review_text: This Highly Advanced SUV has all the Safety and Technology one would ever want or need. Amazing Power and Reliability from its L4 Turbo Engine to its Sleek design Inside and Out. Acura gives you all this at a Reasonable and Competitive Price.

reviews.title: Love the way it look
reviews.review_text: I was going to get Lexus NX until I test drive RDX A-SPEC AWD. Turn out it drive better and to me feel like the car has more power than Lexus NX. I still have 2008 TL Types S for work.

reviews.title: Love my RDX
reviews.review_text: The RDX is absolutely awesome. The only suggestion I have is that the side mirrors automatically fold in upon locking the doors. I also started to look at the MDX; however, when I found out you can’t get it without the 3rd row seating I wasn’t interested. Love, love, love my RDX.

reviews.title: Great Car. I wish that I upgraded to 2021 A-Spec
reviews.review_text: This car was comfortable, reliable, fun to drive, and very practical. It was a lease, and I only drove it for 2 years before being approached by the dealer to upgrade into a 2021. I wanted initially to get the A-Spec which looks great, but they didn't have my color selection, so I decided on the 2021 TLX A-Spec. instead. Also great car, but the RDX was much more comfortable and practical, and had less noise issues...

reviews.title: So far everything we expect from Acura
reviews.review_text: We test drove a lot of other makes and models, the RDX checked of all the boxes, reliable, good resale value, up to date style and technology, and drives like a luxury brand should ride.

reviews.title: My dream car
reviews.review_text: This car met all of my needs it’s beautiful reliable comfortable. I love the panoramic sunroof and heated seats and the beige leather. I’m very happy with my new car.

reviews.title: Absolutely love the car so far
reviews.review_text: This car meets and exceeds my expectations. My wife and I are very pleased and love driving it. Smooth ride, comfortable, very safe ratings, which were all important to us.

reviews.title: Not one problem to date (2 years in)
reviews.review_text: This is a great smaller SUV. I get compliments on mine and how it looks still after 2 years of ownership! I do like the sportiness of the A-spec over the chromed out other versions, but that's just me. I use this around town and in the mountains, including some dirt/bumpy fire roads. I wouldn't call it off roading, but off pavement. The AWD handles flawlessly, which is great. Very peppy for a 4 cyl SUV. Plenty of torque to get it moving and gets upper 20's on the HWY. I do have some quirky issues with Apple CarPlay, but it has gotten better with their updates and I know that some of that can be placed on Apple's updates as well. I use it to haul mountain bikes, kids, my German Shepherd and general stuff back and forth from Raleigh to the Mountains. I have been in snow once, without issue - hey NC doesn't get snow often! I'd buy this car gain, except I wouldn't mind the larger sized MDX. However, we already have a Honda Pilot. The tradeoff is my RDX is way sportier to drive than the Pilot. Mechanically, I have had Zero issues with 32,000 miles on it.

reviews.title: Nice vehicle
reviews.review_text: Like the driving experience the vehicle offers and the tech. Good quality and it has been reliable. The SH-AWD system is great for all road/weather conditions.

reviews.title: Very Stylish
reviews.review_text: This car is my pride and joy. I got it used, but with very low mileage. I have had almost zero problems since the date of purchase, and love showing it off around town.

reviews.title: First import after owning 10+ vehicles
reviews.review_text: Bought a certified used RDX A-Spec. Awesome compact suv for the family. Lots of tec. Beautiful inside and out. Perfect level of sporty and luxury. My only knock on it so far is I wish it had a digital read out of the speed. Haven’t had to look at a needle in over 10 years.

reviews.title: Gorgeous vehicle
reviews.review_text: The car was exactly what I was looking for. Very comfortable and great quality. I feel very good about my purchase today. Highly recommend this car

reviews.title: Great Car!
reviews.review_text: I love this car— inside and out. No complaints or regrets. Acura made styling changes to this model, as well as a different engine than prior years. Both were appreciated improvements.

reviews.title: One of my favorite car I owe so far.
reviews.review_text: This car meet all of my need. It’s reliable and safe plenty of room. Love the trunk for grocery.it’s very comfortable and loaded with technology.

reviews.title: a lot of kit for the money
reviews.review_text: I have a 2019 RDX with the Advance package. You get a lot of kit there for its sub $50000 price - luxury in practically everything but the badge. Comfortable, excellent handling, powerful, right-sized, a long warranty, plus the expected safety systems. I could gripe about the infotainment system, which is overly complicated, but I realized that I can easily access everything I need via the heads-up display. That alone was worth the Advance package premium. Otherwise, there were minor glitches that required a dealer fix - the heated steering wheel that didn't heat - and a software update to fix a balky navigation system. And there was the weird discovery that my new iPhone can interfere with the touch-unlock of the doors. Sometimes I have to hold my phone behind my back to open the driver's door. The push-button transmission needs some getting used to, too, but you have to get used to new systems in any car. I wish the Acura had used fold-back door mirrors, though - they're expensive to replace. But, weigh the pros and cons, and unless you have to have a luxury badge to go with the luxury you can get in the Acura, and are willing to pay the extra freight for the same features, this car is well worth the money.

reviews.title: People stop me and ask where to buy it!
reviews.review_text: Love this sporty vehicle and it is just the right size, handles so well, and has tons of space for hauling around stuff. This is my 3rd Acura and the best ever.

reviews.title: Best most reliable car my wife’s ever driven
reviews.review_text: My wife teaches blind children in 8 different schools in NJ. A lot of driving is required. She loves the car and I love knowing it’s got a superior safety rating and that it’s extremely dependable. You can’t beat an Acura - quality, price, safety, advanced technology - it’s got it all.

reviews.title: Fabulous Value
reviews.review_text: This is my fourth and best Acura. I bought it because of the new styling but the car has been fabulous on the road and absolutely no repairs after two years. Most reliable car ever.

reviews.title: Good after entertainment system replaced
reviews.review_text: It took me a year and a half if repeatedly taking it back into the dealership because the Apple Car Play did not work. It repeatedly crashed. It would crash the entire entertainment system. I could not make or receive calls, use maps, listen to music,etc. Acura replaced the entertainment system about 6 months ago. The new one works as expected. I’m going to say yes, I would recommend it, but I’d insist on the new entertainment system being installed first. The RDX dealership navigation system is awful to use. It is tedious, unresponsive, does not understand what you are “writing “ on the key pad. There is no good way to use it.

reviews.title: Love this car!
reviews.review_text: Acura knocked it out of the park with the styling inside and out. Interior is roomy and intuitive. Seats are fantastic. Perforated leather and extremely comfortable. Engine has all the power I would want with very good efficiency.

reviews.title: Small SUV, but very good value
reviews.review_text: I own the high end trim line with the massive sunroof, top end audio and the vented front seats. It's a lot of technology for a good/reasonable price. But it's still a very small SUV - barely big enough for weekend trips with family of 3.

reviews.title: Solid Compact SUV w/ Minor Reservations
reviews.review_text: I have the entry level "Standard" model with no additional packages. Overall a very good car that I enjoy driving. This is my fourth Acura, the first built in the USA. Panel gaps and alignments are not up to Japanese standards. Not a deal breaker for me, but take a close look at any unit you are considering and make your own call. Interior and exterior design is very nice and materials are quite good. Nice suite of safety features, but no blind-spot monitoring. Expect it in a car costing $40K. Instrument panel and infotainment systems have a learning curve. The panel could use a digital speedometer display, an easy software patch. Would like the option to purchase navigation which would be easy since the car has wi-fi connectivity for software updates. Seats are comfortable for long road trips and the cabin reasonably quiet. Engine and transmission work well together. Sport+ driving mode is a lot of fun. Handles well, but no BMW. In Sport or Comfort modes, steering is a little dead on center. Car drives "big" for a compact. Good sight lines, but the vehicle not as agile as X3 of Q5. Developed suspension noise at around 7K miles which dealer tracked down to loose nut not properly torqued during build. Again not to Japanese standards. Mileage below EPA ratings, 17-18 in town and 25 on the road. Seems like good value for the money.

reviews.title: Lots of standard features sporty & luxury comfort
reviews.review_text: I was initially shopping for Lexus Nx and I figured I check the competition. The Lexus lacked a few things like a bit of "go" on the freeway and the interior looked dated. The Acura had more standard features and also a much more modern interior and more overall interior space. The ride is not as soft as the Lexus but not as stiff as a BMW. It is a great balance of sportyness and comfort. Swawd is great and provides great grip.

reviews.title: Love the RDX
reviews.review_text: I currently own a TLX and was looking for a model that was higher off the ground but still felt like I was driving a car. that's where the RDX comes in. Great cabin, great seats....visually pleasing. The infotainment system is great, hype about the touchpad being difficult is highly overblown. The Aspec model looks sharp on the road and has some fun options with the sport mode. I love the new ride!

reviews.title: Too sporty for my wants.
reviews.review_text: MY third RDX--great cars. Very reliable. The 2019 RDX is a really good car and I recommend it to those who want a really sporty drive, handling, etc. A bit too noisy (ending noise piped into cabin--stupid). Rinse is okay but not a luxury ride for sure. Handling is very good for this size car. Lots of power. A standout sound system. I just found the car didn't grow on me. I liked the 2nd generation with the 6 cylinder much more.

reviews.title: Worst technology I've seen in years
reviews.review_text: The mechanically the car works fine. The technology items are awful. The touch pad never works right. It is programmed to turn the fan down when the navigation is speaking. Not so good at 115 degrees. The navigation is cumbersome and difficult to use.

reviews.title: Very Satisfied
reviews.review_text: Researched the RDX front to back before purchase. Have had it now one year. The vehicle does what I had hoped. Handles well in dry, wet and Snow! Comfortable in long road trips and quiet. Infotainment console slight learning curve..

reviews.title: Great car and easy process
reviews.review_text: This car met both the performance and style standards that I wanted. As a used vehicle, the low mileage (<3,000) was a huge plus. Vince Cuffaro and Crown Acura made the entire purchase process a breeze. We are really enjoying our RDX!

reviews.title: Best value for the money
reviews.review_text: Love the vehicle. Only change I would make is no push button shifter. Inconvenient. Everything else is great. Has plenty of horse power. Safety is superb

reviews.title: excellent vehicle, fun to drive
reviews.review_text: Love this car! Great ride, handling, and performance! Great for daily commuting and for travel with our 2 large dogs. Expecting many happy miles ahead.

reviews.title: Pretty decent for the money
reviews.review_text: Had it for over one year and it's been mostly okay. So far the transmission has been the biggest disappointment. It often chooses the wrong gear and Rev hangs like crazy when it needs to down shift. The other issue I had was the sunroof cover motor failure that needed replacement. The infotainment pad thing is a bit hard to use. Kind of distracting. The ride is on the firmer side. It's cheaper than the European rivals but there maybe a reason for that.

reviews.title: Slammin!
reviews.review_text: This small suv is a blast to drive, has all the bells whistles that a person could want and is very efficient with gas mileage.

reviews.title: Don’t buy it. Do your research
reviews.review_text: This is a 40-50k car that almost as soon as you drive it off the lot the brakes start squeaking and they can’t fix it. That is an expensive car to have your brakes squeak. Call any dealer and talk with service department they will verify it.

reviews.title: IF YOU LIKE SQUEALING BRAKES ON A $45,000 CAR...
reviews.review_text: Do not buy this car. I bought the Rdx 2020 brand new and have had it in for 2 repairs. They cannot fix the brakes and I am embarrassed to drive it in public. This sound is loud. Acura is aware of it and Has no fix, but won’t take the car back. Will have to sue through lemon law. This was my 5th Honda product and due to their failure to stand by their warenty, it will be my last.

reviews.title: Very reliable car
reviews.review_text: This is my first acura i’ve owned. Its so far the best car ever. It runs so smooth & the interior is absolutely stunning. It has so many features and has alot of space front and back.

reviews.title: Excellent design with a few flaws.
reviews.review_text: The car is fun to drive, something most SUVs do not provide. It's not as quiet on the highway as a Lexus RX, but getting both qualities in the same vehicle is probably impossible. I have the Advance trim model with SH-AWD, which offers almost every feature you could want as standard. The seats are great, with 16 way adjustments for both the driver and passenger. The storage area behind the second row is good for a vehicle of its size, plus there is a hidden under floor area as well. Flip the rear seats down, and you can carry all types of bulky things. Performance is very good, although the transmission can be a bit jerky in the 1-2 and 2-3 upshift under moderate acceleration. Gas mileage is about 23 mpg mixed town and urban driving; the best I have ever gotten was 27 mpg, the worst about 19 mpg. The quality of the audio system is very good, and the 360 degree camera system is awesome. My car was made during the first few months of production in the summer of 2018, and required a lot of software updates to the infotainment system during the first 6-9 months of ownership. Things have settled down now, and the dreaded "updating" message that never went away is in the past. What could Acura do to make it 5 stars? Here are a few starting points: First, add power folding outside mirrors to cars for the US market; Canadian cars get them, as do most of the cars in the segment they compete in. The heated steering wheel is a dealer option for lower trim models; make it an option for all models and give me the power mirrors! I live in Florida and have only turned it on once in 18 months of ownership, just to see how warm it gets - it gets warm quick. Second, add the remote engine start feature to the key fob. We also own a 2017 Honda CR-V Touring, and Honda includes this feature on the fob as standard. Acura makes you pay for a somewhat pricey and glitchey app to get this feature, or pay the dealer $400 or so for a fob that includes this feature. Third, get rid of the fake engine sounds that get piped into the cabin, especially in the Sport and Sport + settings; it's even there in the Comfort mode upon acceleration. The advance trim level offers adjustable dampers, which is good, but leave out the fake engine sounds (or make it sound like an Acura NSX). I hope this helps. So, a solid 4 Stars, and I would buy it again

reviews.title: Do yourself a favor buy another car
reviews.review_text: Buy another model save money and time. Good car years ago, not now. Junk, junk, junk, junk,junk,junk, junk, Junk, junk,junk junk,junkjunk,junk junk , junkjunkjunk, junk, junk.

reviews.title: I just purchased the car love it so far.
reviews.review_text: It’s the best auto I have ever owned, the technology is fantastic it almost drives itself. Styling is top line great apps has everything one would want in an auto

reviews.title: Test drove it, but ...
reviews.review_text: Yesterday I test drove the RDX. Loved it. Then came home and read lots and lots of reviews. Totally changed my mind. Too many problems. Won’t be buying it after all. Thanks to all reviewers.

reviews.title: Finally got my dream car
reviews.review_text: Loving how it handles itself on the winter roads. Im pleased with how it handles. Originally looked at MDX but the RDX was the perfect size

reviews.title: Love!
reviews.review_text: I have only had my RDX for 11 days and very pleased so far. It handles amazing in snow and ice. There is a lot of technology on this vehicle but I feel I'm learning pretty quickly. This is a fun vehicle to drive and comfortable!

reviews.title: Isssues - good and bad
reviews.review_text: Basic car functions are OK. Purchased for some of the new safety features. Quickly found out some ARE NOT safe and actually create problems. Basic package DOES NOT have "blind spot" but that's ok since mirrors are excellent and I don't put a lot of trust in the spot detection after all the other issues with detection. ACC (automatic cruise control) with 'follow me' does work BUT you have to be careful when you actually stop. If the car ahead turns, the ACC immediately tries to accelerate you from stop to max speed setting, so you have to remember to turn it off. Lane Departure is TERRIBLE. It has swept me into the other lane without warning, it can't find the edges of the lane with any degree of accuracy. If you want to exit your lane, better use your turn signal or the car will try to prevent you and significantly impact turning - first time scared me. It also falsely will detect a car in lane next to you as moving into your lane and hit the brakes, could be worse with blind spot - don't know. It's not perfect so I turn off everything I can - so now you have a basic car for which you paid extra for the safety features that don't actually work correctly and if it doesn't work properly, it's a hazard to driving.

reviews.title: Picked a bad one
reviews.review_text: Test drove it. Bought it. Noticed a faint high buzzing sound like when you’re on a flight. Thought it was just a louder cabin than my previous Lexus. One morning it got louder and while I accelerated. But not when I let off the gas. And not while accelerating in park. I only noticed it because I was driving in silence, which is how I drive after dropping my child off at daycare. Immediately took it in 2 hours later because I’m generally paranoid. I have a 2 year old. It’s my responsibility to keep her alive. Two days later, and a wheel bearing replacement despite mention of the transmission, they’re replacing the whole transmission. It’s a year old, brand new, off the lot. Obviously covered. Service guys were great to work with, no complaints there. Considering I was not far off from experiencing a the documented “limp” mode. I’m surprised I got this far in it. And I’ve been driving with my toddler every day. Hour long trips every week. What if! Once I get it back, I’ll be trading it in for anything but an Acura in a reasonable amount of time. Hopefully it doesn’t effect the value. I paid for brand new to avoid these issues, but now that investment seems wasted on lack of quality control and manufacturer defect. I’m not waiting around to see what else happens. The Lemon law arbitration looks like a headache.

reviews.title: Great car!
reviews.review_text: This car is beautiful and drives great! I wish I had purchased one with more safety features on it (my fault!). Shortly after I bought the car, I got pulled over for speeding. Oops! The officer was so interested in my car, he let me go!

reviews.title: Appealing to the eye. Nice to drive. Excellent des
reviews.review_text: This car is comfortable and appealing to the eye. Interior design attracted me to buy this car. But so far I am a little dissappointed because I had problem with the breaking system within a year and the tire is not reliable. So far I am 60% satisfy with the car.

reviews.title: Bad Transmission
reviews.review_text: 2019 Rdx with 12000 plus miles needs a new transmission already. Read other people’s reviews regarding all the trans problems. The Acura app is a joke.

reviews.title: Base model has everything you could want or need.
reviews.review_text: All of the safety, convenience and technology features I was looking for are in the base model. It even comes equipped with a panoramic moon roof. Quality inside and out. I was concerned about Apple car play, since I have Android, but they updated it to include it. Even on the '19 that was the last on the lot, which we got a great deal on.

reviews.title: Great value jack of all trades
reviews.review_text: I like the car. It's good at everything but not great at one thing...besides the awd aspect. Looks are subjective but I like the a spec pack. I will say that the gas mileage needs improvement. Interior design is comfortable and good in quality. The information tech console is subpar but I'm able to adapt to it. Over all I do recommend to people that like good value and good performance at a better price than competitors.

reviews.title: Satellite Radio issue
reviews.review_text: The car is just ok. It shifts constantly making for an unsmooth and noisy ride. The satellite radio takes 2 minutes or longer to connect rendering the controls useless.

reviews.title: 2019 Acura RDX Technology with Navigation
reviews.review_text: This vehicle has so many pluses and luxury standard features that the odd entertainment system is a minor inconvenience. I understand the reasoning behind the system. Easy reach of controls so you keep your eyes on the road. Mastered this entertainment system in a few days. If you are looking for a luxury compact suv, this should be near the top of the list. Great value.

reviews.title: Acura missed the mark
reviews.review_text: Purchased new in Oct. 2018 with Navigation Package. Car rides and handles well. Has a nice luxury car feel until you turn on the radio, try to use the navigation system or make a phone call. The infotainment system constantly fails and Acura doesn't seem to care. I've taken it to the dealer 6+ times over this issue and all I'm told is Acura is working on a software update. It's now a year later and no update. Sad that this issue takes away from what could be a great car.

reviews.title: 2019 rdx a spec
reviews.review_text: This car drive very nice and looks nice .. leg room good [I'm 6 feet] plenty of power for me ...gas mileage average on highway around 26-28 miles ... sits 5 comfortable.... storage is average.. it's a best buy for the money ..

reviews.title: Acura needs to fix the infotainment system!
reviews.review_text: The infotainment system on our 2019 Acura RDX has been down for more than 90 days. This includes the navigation system, sound system, phone connections and basic information system. Our dealer says they have 1000 customers on a contact list needing the problem fixed. It is not a priority to Acura and they do not have an estimated time to get it fixed. This is a pretty critical set of components in this day and age. We probably won't rush back to buy another one and you should think about it too!

reviews.title: This car has a design flaw which Acura has no fix.
reviews.review_text: This vehicle is not reliable and should be pulled out of showrooms until they find a fix. It is not safe. The computer screen malfunctions, staying on even when the car is turned off. The battery dies. Acura roadside assistance has to come and charge the battery. The car is then driven to service and they claim there is no fix. Acura knows there is no fix

reviews.title: Luxurious, classy. Love technology package
reviews.review_text: I love my Acura RDX. I especially love the graphics on the dashboard as well as the technology package. Interior design is exceptional. I will certainly buy another Acura.

reviews.title: Computer system is F***ed. Acura can't fix it.
reviews.review_text: The computer system causes the car's battery to die. Acura service admits they cannot fix the problem. Do not get this vehicle. I repeat do not get this vehicle. 3500 miles and it's a piece of junk.

reviews.title: Electronics suck
reviews.review_text: I like the car, but the electronics suck. The infotainment center is difficult to use. I thought I knew how to do it but it changes on it's own. Sometimes I can set a station and sometimes I can't - it's up to the car's mood. The GPS sucks. It worked fine - then after I connected Apple to it one time to listen to my music, the infotainment system didn't work right any longer. This isn't just with my car. I have read the blogs and this is a major problem. I can't get the GPS to work - no matter what I do. I used to love it, ,but now I hate it. I wouldn't get this car again.

reviews.title: Most horrible car
reviews.review_text: totally broken infotainment system which the dealership cannot fix and now have filed corporate complaint - dropped calls - loud popping from speakers - switches from Sirius to FM radio on its own - creates dangerous distractions - horrible!!!

reviews.title: 'Upgrade' from Honda to Acura: Bad Experience
reviews.review_text: Had been a Honda owner for over ten years- various models all new, I had NEVER had an issue with my Honda's. I wanted a small SUV and I wanted a bit of an upgrade, after test driving many vehicles the Acura RDX seemed to fit what I needed. I've owned the vehicle for under two months. From the beginning, the sunroof will 'shift' when going over speed bumps/ changes in terrain on the road. The shifting is a loud POP- seeming to be the body shifting all the weight or stress of the car to the large opening of the sunroof. I took the car to Acura dealer, they were unable to hear what I was talking about. Car is still making the noise daily. The bigger, and more scary problem is that in the infotainment center gets fuzzy or makes popping noises (as described by others) the system goes black *EVERYTHING GOES BLACK* a message says network connection lost, and the whole system restarts. Important to note that you cannot control anything as far as navigation, music, radio, clock, change modes of drive, etc. I took the vehicle in to Acura, they said there was a system update and that the downloaded it and it should be better. The day after I got my car back, it started again. One day while on an 2 hour car trip, it restarted 26 times. My fiance and I started a betting game on how many times it would restart. Acura claims that this is an Apple issue, and they're waiting for an update from Apple. I do not believe this is the case, this happens when my phone is connected, when it's not connected, when it's plugged in, when nothing is connected and just playing the radio. In my non-car-knowing brain, I believe this is a heat issue. When my car is parked in the garage and cooler, or when I am driving at night- this seems to happen less or not at all. When it's been parked in the hot sun all day and the car is hot- that's when this happens. To me, this seems to be some sort of connection issue or heat issue, not an Apple issue as stated by the Acura car dealer. I plan to take my car back again to forcefully make them fix the car. Possibly return the car.

reviews.title: Since I was a victim of fraud and tricked into th
reviews.review_text: Would have paid more for the car of my choice except being tricked into this car on lies and deceit after my oxygen tank was depleted and I wasn’t able to make an intelligent decision.

reviews.title: Most Problems I've Ever Had With a Vehicle
reviews.review_text: Experienced numerous random intermittent problems with the "entertainment system" (and apparently other) software. System froze several times. Dropped phone calls. Dropped satellite music service at random. Lane departure warning system turned itself on and off at random. Object-approach warnings happened at random. BRAKE warning light came on at random. Cruise control vehicle-approach slowed RDX down while we were passing a car in another lane (only supposed to appear when you're approaching another vehicle from directly behind). Other problems too numerous to mention - all of which happened randomly, which meant that the dealer (who made honest efforts to address the problems) was unable to duplicate. Published reports allege that Acura apparently knew about the problems when it released the 2019 and 2020 RDX, and has reportedly lied several times about when the corrected software would be available. We felt the 2019 RDX was too dangerous and unreliable to continue using. Disposed of it and got a reliable SUV at a financial loss.

reviews.title: 2ND RDX I'VE OWNED
reviews.review_text: Love this car. I most recently owned a 2017 RDX. They've revamped and made the 2019 even better. Love it. Even at the base model ... it is like the luxury model for other brands.

reviews.title: Nice luxury car
reviews.review_text: Interior very comfortable and cab is very quiet. Nice looking suv. Cheaper than other luxury suv. Still have the Honda reliability. Lots of power. Averaged mpg 26 to 28. A little surprised by motor shutting of at stop light. But does help mpg.

reviews.title: ASPEC is so fun to drive!!!
reviews.review_text: Has everything you will ever need in a car. I had 2 MDX’s when the kids were smaller and I switched to the RDX... it’s better on gas and a blast to drive!

reviews.title: Love my RDX so far
reviews.review_text: I’ve only owned it for 48 hours now, but I researched this car and several others in its class, and if you want the most bang for your buck, buy an RDX. I got the SH-AWD Advance model with all the bells and whistles, and love the fit and finish of this SUV. The true touchpad interface got mixed reviews in many reviews I read, but I’m finding the learning curve very short in getting a feel for using it. Only two things I would change about the car if I could: the button to turn off the Auto Idle Stop feature should let you turn it off completely, because the shudder when re-accelerating is annoying and the button resets each time you start the car. The second thing is: this car needs a change holder for coins for tolls, meters, etc. These are nit picky things, however, and the engineers nailed it with every other aspect of this car. The dynamic driving modes are great, the head up display is great, the engine is lively, the interior is ultra comfortable and plush. The cockpit puts everything ergonomically where the driver can easily get to it. My absolute favorite thing on the RDX - the 16 speaker surround sound stereo system. It’s absolutely amazing and the best I’ve ever heard in a vehicle. I highly recommend the 2019 RDX Advance!

reviews.title: Scared away by concerns about transmission
reviews.review_text: We really loved the looks and performance of the RDX. We probably would have bought it if not for what seemed like an excessive amount of reviews of current owners commenting about transmission and brake issues. We had a 2000 Acura TL where the transmission went out on it with around 60,000 miles but the warranty had expired based on how long we had owned it ( It was our baby that we only drove in ideal conditions) but Acura had no sympathy for us. Therefore, the concerns about the transmission on the 2019 RDX caused us to pause and move away from buying it. If Acura addresses the transmission concerns in the future, I would buy it!

reviews.title: This car needs to be recalled
reviews.review_text: Daughter purchased all out 2019 RDX! Nothing but problems. started with the radio not working, gps doesn’t work, terrible gas miles! Finally car got stuck in gear in the middle of a busy intersection, could not go past 20 miles.

reviews.title: Beautiful- Excellent Car
reviews.review_text: This car is above and beyond expectations. We read and watched many reviews that rated this car as excellent. Believe me it is luxury without the exorbitant price tag.

reviews.title: one of the reliable cars I own
reviews.review_text: Excellent for its price, sleek and easy handle. Excellent display makes me aware of how I drive With speed limitation projection at various road help drive safer

reviews.title: Love this car! They thought of everything with the
reviews.review_text: New Acura RDX exceeds my expectations and has all the extras I didn’t have in my BMW. Smooth ride and easy to master technology options

reviews.title: Too much money
reviews.review_text: I feel it costs way too much for the 2019 RDX. It has a lot of bells and whistles that I don’t feel I need. I wish I could permanently turn them off. For example; the brake warning system and the lane crossing system. It’s very very annoying while driving. If your on the highway or road where they have cracked sealed or the middle line slightly moved when repainted the alarm goes off and the steering wheel starts to shake. I’ve never leased a car so annoying as this one. The other thing is when your at a red light or stop sign the vehicle turns off then starts back up when you step on the gas. The car is comfortable but too annoying to me. Can’t wait for the lease to be done. Never again, I can promise you that. The lease price is very expensive also. $600 a month. That’s CRAZY. I wish I didn’t jump into this lease so quickly, should have put a little more thought into it first.

reviews.title: Very disappointed
reviews.review_text: This vehicle has lots of bells and whistles that you don't need but are missing the important things that ARE needed. (Blind spot detector should be standard - and no one needs the car to turn off at a red light.). My RDX is 8 months old and is making a horrible noise that no one can figure out so I'm just stuck with it.

reviews.title: My wife loves this cae
reviews.review_text: She has had her eye on an RDX and we finally got it. A half year, 15k miles later she is quite pleased with its comfort, reliability, and appearance. Occasionally I even get to drive it and it is a pleasure .

reviews.title: It's pretty. It's fast. The tech doesn't work.
reviews.review_text: I've owned a 2019 RDX Aspec since December 2018. Since then, it's been back to the dealership 3x due to infotech issues - the screens have gone dark, the nav will repeatedly change colors (day-to-night) when it's still daytime, the steering wheel controls don't always allow me to change channels, and I receive error messages about changing my drive mode even when not changing my drive mode. Additionally, when I purchased the car, I realized the Aspec trim doesn't offer a spare. The sales person told me I could have it added. Since then, I've been told it's not an option for the Aspec. Whether it is or isn't, it's been frustrating. For the money, and reputation, I'd have expected a more reliable car and more straight-forward answers on the spare.

reviews.title: Love the car, but worried about grinding brakes
reviews.review_text: Really think this is a great, stylish and fun vehicle. Love it except for the grinding brake problem. Very worrisome. Purchased new and have had it for several months. Only a few thousand miles on it. Brakes grind off and on. From what I am learning, the Acura dealers don't know what it is - so we should just live with it? Very disappointing.

reviews.title: Horn not working from the first day I bought .
reviews.review_text: Absolutely hate it. Dealers are just tossing to fix the broken horn in brand new car. Very very disappointing. Want to return the car ASAP.

reviews.title: Amazing car
reviews.review_text: This car has surpassed all my needs and expectations. I’m very satisfied with all the features so far and still enjoying new perks since of my purchase date of May 2019. Kudos to Acura of Denville very professional.

reviews.title: Many alert safety features are terrific.
reviews.review_text: Very comfortable and quite and responsive. Great get up and go when needed! All the inner functions are easily workable. The sound system is terrific.

reviews.title: Can’t get used to 4 banger
reviews.review_text: Car is very nice in so many ways. Roomy. Comfy. Looks good. Decent on fuel. Only way to get this dog going below 2000 rpm is sport plus mode. It sounds nit picky but the turbo lag off the line is unpleasant.

reviews.title: Really an upgrade from our 2017 RLX Advanced
reviews.review_text: Acura has really done a nice job with this vehicle. It is truly quieter than our 2017. It may take a bit on the UI.

reviews.title: Stylish with Hi-Tech features
reviews.review_text: This car is an upgrade to the Acura TLX I leased. Greater legroom and greater headroom. Greater road clearance as well. It has plenty of power to get on the highway. It provides the style you pay for higher priced cars. A new feature is full glass roofing. The basic model comes with fine leather seats. The transmission is push button and navigation of radio, Apple Car Play and other functions is via a touch pad. Radio stations can be selected by voice command. The only negatives I have are that it requires premium gas and average mpg is like all Acuras-less than other brands. (But I knew that before buying it.)

reviews.title: Great SUV with cutting edge technology
reviews.review_text: Love it- powerful engine, comfortable with plenty of cargo space, with cutting edge technology. I looked at a few other SUVs and felt that the RDX was far superior

reviews.title: My second RDX
reviews.review_text: I really enjoyed driving my 2017 RDX. I called it my pocket rocket. Little did I know I was in training for the next gen RDX. I’ve had my 2019 RDX for a week and it has been a rush.

reviews.title: Most reliable car!!!
reviews.review_text: Best car ever !!!!! I had diff cars bf but this os deff the best car ... i love how fast and comfortable it is

reviews.title: Stylish, Fun and Functional!
reviews.review_text: I love my new Acura RDX! I have the red exterior with the black interior, which is beautiful. It has many safety features and additional features that make driving the car fun and easy!

reviews.title: Love the RDX W/ Tech Pkg
reviews.review_text: Test drove 6 different mid-size SUV's. RDX , for me, by far most stylish, with great tech and safety features. Super comfortable, inside is like a cockpit with everything handy, love the sunroof, turbo, SH-AWD and tech!! Get one!

reviews.title: Worse than my 1996 Didge Neon
reviews.review_text: My 1996 Dodge Neon was my first car. And it was a piece of junk...but at least it was priced right. I have a 2019 Acura RDX Advanced model. I leased it in November and to date (May 24, 2019) only have 5,890 miles on the car. My informant system completely shuts down and disabled all functionality -including Bluetooth. Shortly after this happens- electrical popping can be heard throughout my dashboard. If you can imagine the firework poppers that you throw on the ground? Yes- that is the exact sound that comes out of my dashboard for lengths of appx 20 minutes at a time. That’s not scary at all, right? Electrical malfunction? I brought the vehicle immediately into the dealer on Monday, April 29 as I was extremely fearful of my safety. They had the car for the day and said that a hard reset of my car had to be done and it was ready for pick up. Tuesday, April 30th the informant system is down again and the popping is back....soooo now it’s going back to Acura again for a second time. Acura has the car May 2-3 and has decided that the car has a faulty gauge control. A new part is ordered and replaced. GREAT! Until it’s not great. Only two weeks later as I am in the middle of a 200+ mile road trip POP POP POP and there goes the system again with the sound back. My RDX is currently in the shop and they have been very transparent that they don’t know what is wrong with it. My car has been in the shop for 9 days this month and I have lost complete trust in the vehicle itself and do not feel safe in it.

reviews.title: I absolutely love the way it drives.
reviews.review_text: The car has met all of my needs. I’m absolutely in love with it. I purchased the Acura RDX APEC model and would highly recommend others to consider this model.

reviews.title: Poor build quality
reviews.review_text: Leased this car in October 2018. It has been in the shop 3 times. The front breaks squeak. Dealer said there was nothing they could do. Then a loud popping and cracking noise cane from the speakers. Acura issued a press release about this problem. Dealer is currently trying to fix this problem. Stay away from this car.

reviews.title: Sheep in Wolf's clothing...
reviews.review_text: This is a car with an identity crisis. It looks like a really fast car, yet it's really not fast and it's really not a luxury car. The engine is awesome but the transmission is horrible. With 10 speeds, it seems to have trouble making up it's mind of when to shift and when not to. Upshifts speeds are noticeably faster than downshifts but only if you are very deliberate with the throttle. During low to moderate speed driving, the car shifts all over the place just to keep you in the torque band, making for a very uncomfortable ride for a "luxury" crossover. And what's with the fake engine "noise" being piped through the speakers? The car is noisy enough on it's own. It's just obnoxious and it can't be turned off. Not going to add too much to the bad (and very slow) infotainment system or to the unreliable safety features that haven't already been brought up in other reviews. Overall, I would suggest anyone looking to buy this car, take it for more than a 5 minute spin before making a purchase. Take it around town for an hour and try some "normal" driving in traffic and see for yourself. Definitely try the lane keep assist and collision avoidance features and see for yourself if they seem helpful or just downright dangerous. After putting 6000 miles on mine, here's the good and bad in my opinion. Good: Great design work on the body and most of the interior. Strong engine - unfortunately mated to a bad transmission Great SH-AWD system. This thing is glued to the road. Chassis is very stiff and feels quite solid Bad: Horribly slow infotainment system (maybe due to the fact that it's a very old version of android). Horribly slow transmission and it shifts CONSTANTLY for no reason. Sound deadening in this vehicle is just subpar for anything trying to be labeled as a luxury vehicle. You can hear everything outside, but that's typical Honda. Silly engine note being piped into the speakers that you can't turn off. Leather on the seats feel cheap and so do the rest of the plastics and the seats are stiffer than they need to be Storage in center console could be better designed. To wrap things up - This car has been quite a let down since day 1. I've owned a lot of cars and this would be the first one that I really just don't like to drive. Maybe I'm expecting too much for $48k but I just think they could do so much better.

reviews.title: Beautiful inside and out. q
reviews.review_text: This car is gorgeous with a smooth and peppy ride. It handles great with a sporty feel. It has all the bells and whistles that one could want and the newest safety features.

reviews.title: RDXiculous Ride
reviews.review_text: By far the most sporty crossover in its class. Interior styling is unmatched. We already own the TLX Aspec, and wanted a crossover that would match it looks. The RDX Aspec was a no brainer. Very happy with purchase

reviews.title: A Luxury SUV at an affordable price.
reviews.review_text: This car met all of our needs. The superior handling, exterior appearance, the technology package, the interior design, spacious area for passengers, and plenty of storage in the back

reviews.title: Most attractive SUV, does everything I need.
reviews.review_text: This car meets most of my needs, good handling, responsive engine, great ride and safe as they come and very stylish. Surprised car did not come with GPS or CD player which I over looked, at least in the base model I purchased.

reviews.title: Outstanding engineering, performance and comfort!
reviews.review_text: I've had my 2019 RDX for three weeks. The car is solid and gives a driver confidence in control and maneuvering through city traffic or on the highway. The technology and creature comforts are intuitively designed and further enhance the driving experience. And drop dead good looks in styling inside and out! A pure winner.

reviews.title: 10K miles and all is great
reviews.review_text: We have experienced all of the good mentioned in these reviews and none of the bad. Over the air updates have eliminated most infotainment flaws, so the purchase of a recently built RDX should provide a near perfect vehicle. I do not understand how someone could have a serious problem adapting to the True Touchpad.

reviews.title: Beautiful car that drives like a dream
reviews.review_text: I love everything about the 2019 RDX, from the grill to the taillights and everything in between. The technology is amazing and the car drives wonderfully. So happy am I!

reviews.title: Drove for 4 days as a loaner while TL was in shop
reviews.review_text: I found the dash and features new and updated. Takes a while to navigate the pad and radio but figured it out. The sound system is important to me and it seems my TL actually sounds a little better. For a 4-cylinder it handles and responds very well with the assistance of the turbo! I’ve owned three Acuras so considering buying the RDX also. Comfortable and excellent seat adjustments for shorter people too. More comfortable than the Mercedes E450 I had for a couple of weeks. I did not experience issues that some others seem to have written about so overall liked it very much.

reviews.title: Happy with my purchase.
reviews.review_text: So far we have recorded a little over 1000 miles on our RDX. No problems or complaints so far. The last two tanks of gas we recorded a little over 25 mpg. Infotainment system takes a little getting used to but I will get used to it. Love the fact that I can change driving modes.

reviews.title: BEST CAR I'VE EVER OWNED
reviews.review_text: We leased the Tech Pkg 2019 RDX about a month ago. First, the cons: it is a little more noisy than our previous vehicle, 2016 TLX - Tech Pkg. The address book of the Nav Systems will list commercial favorites with name but not personal ones. However, this is not a deal breaker as you can use your Contacts in your smart phone instead. Pros: This car is really peppy as compared to our 6 cylinder 2016 TLX . The reviewer of this car did not like the new touch pad but I have to tell you, I love it. It is easy to learn and easy to use. So, younger people (I'm 75 years old and had the touch pad down pat in 3 days flat), get over it. The interior cabin is luxurious and despite the noise being a little higher than our previous TLX (see above), the ride is smoother. This vehicle is a SUV or shall I say CUV and is not supposed to be fun to drive except...........it is! Just put it into Sport + mode and off you go. The Adaptive Cruise Control and front/back camera sensors plus blind-spot monitoring is fantastic as is the Nav System; yes, the Nav system is great so when they finally do install Android Auto, we may not even use it. We love this vehicle. It is the best vehicle I've ever owned and I've owned a bunch of them.

reviews.title: Very good and reliable SUV
reviews.review_text: We love this SUV, due to Cars.com we where able to locate the used 2019 SUV with 1200 miles and paid 8% less than new vehicle.

reviews.title: Fantastic Amazing Sporty RDX
reviews.review_text: Great ride with sporty appearance. I traded in my Range Rover Evoque for this reliable Acura. I owned an MDX years ago and decided to go back to the Acura family. Happy to be back looking through the panoramic sun/moonroof.

reviews.title: Second thoughts
reviews.review_text: I traded a 6 cyl. 2016 RDX for a 2019 Advanced package 6 months ago. My biggest disappointment is the mileage. I got around 25 - 27 around town and as much as 35 mpg highway on the 2016 but only 18 local and 23 hwy on a lucky day on the 2019. Ridiculous! The turbo 4, and 10 speed transmission coupled with auto shut off simply does not achieve advertised mpg. Changing drive modes - comfort or sport - does not make a difference. The push button transmission is manageable but not attractive. The 4 cyl. turbo does have enough zip although the turbo is a bit noisy. On the plus side the ride for the Advanced model is smoother than 2016 which had a ride that was too rigid/sharp over even the smallest rough surface. My general impression is Acura engineers have too much time on their hands needlessly spent trying to trick out this model. Interior space is more than ample but so was the 2016. Nevertheless it would have been better used by keeping the 6 cylinder which I believe shut down cylinders at cruising speed and prior transmission with much better mpg. The technology is nice but again over engineered. Whatever happened to “keep it simple”?

reviews.title: This car is one of the worst I have owned
reviews.review_text: The car rides good; the brakes work well, and I like the navigation system. Otherwise the car is haunted. I have had numerous phone issues; the radio turns itself on at will and often does not allow me to change channels. Twice the lane departure caused the car to stop in traffic, and I turned that "feature" off Also twice the car refused to go out of Park, and I was literally stuck in my garage. The dealership says they cannot fix anything they cannot duplicate, so they have done nothing. They say they cannot replace the software either, which seems to be where most of the issues are coming from. This is my first and last Acura, and I have only had it for 6 months. I will trade it as soon as I find a good replacement. Stay away from this car!

reviews.title: Great to drive, but
reviews.review_text: Comfortable, great to drive, but the electronic screen is confusing, unreliable, frustrating and not user friendly. Shocked to learn after purchasing that it has no CD player to accommodate my large collection. The latter are the reasons I would not recommend to a friend. The unreliable rating refers to the electronic screen.

reviews.title: always wanted an rdx with sh awd
reviews.review_text: meets all my expectations. I've had many of the great sport and muscle cars in my 70 years of driving, and this one puts it all together in one package -outstanding handling, power, sounds and looks. All in all a truly great ride for anyone who loves cars and loves to drive. And, the price is right.

reviews.title: Lemon Arbitration next week
reviews.review_text: Bought this vehicle last June, one of the first on the road. Has been in the shop 80 days on multiple occasions for many issues: Horn kept blowing fuses and not working, infotainment system goes black, defects in windshield, steering wheel, hatch motor, leather seats. Infotainment system gives irrelevant warnings -- like "no drive mode available" when i don't even try to access it. BRAKE warning goes on even if nothing in front of me. I could go on. Acura Customer Service has had a case open since the vehicle was 2 weeks old and dangled buyback for months until I gave up and filed for arbitration a long 4 months ago. What a slow process. At this time all issues are fixed except the infotainment and random commands, and those present maybe 1/4 of the time I drive it and on final inspection, field rep could not duplicate. SO their response in writing is there is nothing wrong with the vehicle, it is safe, and has not lost value. I fear Acura/Honda will not do right by me unless at hearing the issue presents. I can only hope the 80 days out of service total will win me compensation. Florida Lemon says 30 days out of service so we shall see.....but no matter what, I will NOT keep the vehicle even if I take a huge loss. Two Acura dealers refuse to buy it back. A Honda dealer pulled up Carfax and questioned all the service visits (CarFax does not detail issues), and CarMax cannot even find my car in the system with the VIN. Huh??!!! A 20 year Honda/Acura customer is not being treated well by the company.

reviews.title: Love our 2019 RDX
reviews.review_text: This vehicle is a luxurious SUV. After much research on its competitors and wanting to stay in the Honda family although it’s not a Honda it’s the closest thing. So far we only have good things to say about our experience.

reviews.title: just traded my 2010 RDX for a 2019....awesome !
reviews.review_text: this SUV is fun to drive. I tested other brands, and even though we could have saved lots of $ by going others, we thought the extra money is worth every penny!

reviews.title: MPG? Navi? Transmission???
reviews.review_text: No one is talking about the horrid gas mileage. I traded a 6 in for a 4/turbo following the recommended MPG of 20 -25. I have never gotten over 18! I average 14mpg and I know why. The transmission shifts at odd times leaving the engine to require Turbo constantly and bringing the MPG way down. Bar far the least efficient vehicle I have ever owned. I mean it is horrible. Speaking of transmission.. if you dare to start in sport or sport plus before warming up the car, the computer just redlines first gear. You basically have to paddle shift the gears or go back to D mode. But drive mode as I said, is where the MPG drops significant. Trying to find a setting or paddle shift gears to increase MPG is ridiculous. Navigation? Cannot tell you how many times I screamed at the voice navigation . Can’t find xxxx and when it does you pretty much are at your destination or while driving went past the turn you needed to take. I mean.. the amount it takes to find a destination is like using an APPLE II LC vs and IMAC. It literally takes minutes to find a destination. I dont think it is a software issue as much as hardware. They probably skimped on a faster processor. No Excsue. Yes a fully loaded RDX is $10K cheaper than QS5, GLC AMG 43, or X5 M but the additional $10K is worth it in my opinion. They missed the mark on these failures and could of really penetrated the market if they paid attention to those enthusiastic drivers who would want to purchase this type of vehicle. Unless I see a significant improvement in a software upgrade soon, I am taking a loss and trading my Advanced for a Mercedes or Audi. Extremely dissatisfied. I dont see how the gas mileage will ever change unless they fix the gear ratios.

reviews.title: Dare To Compare
reviews.review_text: This is my 7th leased Acura. You can not beat the value of an Acura. My current ride is the '19 RDX SH-AWD w/Tech and Key Fob Remote in Performance Red with Beige interior. Hardly a day goes by that I don't get compliments on its good looks. The handling and ride is excellent with the SH-AWD. Performance is very good, though not as good as my Acura TL (sedans)Type-S'. The audio system is awesome and the vehicle is very comfortable, even for 5 adults. It is no wonder Acura leads sales in this segment by a long shot.

reviews.title: Disappointed I bought this car!

reviews.title: I Always go with Acura

reviews.title: Infotainment Glitches

reviews.title: Worst Acura I've owned!

reviews.title: Noisiest ride ever!
reviews.review_text: Just leased the 2019 RDX + Tech in February; White with beautiful brown interior. LIKE: ride, safety features, interior is outstanding, stylish exterior, Infotainment center. Took a few days to learn Infotainment features but I love it. DISLIKES: Road noise and vibration like sounds is unbearable. Don't know why it happens. Luckily doesn't happen on all road surfaces. reviews.title: Never been more satisfied with a car purchase
reviews.review_text: Acura has hit a home run with the 2019 RDX. It stylish, fun to drive, high tech and high quality. I test drove an RDX back in the day and it was an uncomfortable CRV. reviews.title: Technological improvement s are impressive.

reviews.title: It has it all

reviews.title: Most dianamic SUV!

reviews.title: love my new car!
